name: Sheet-Pan Sausage & Roast Vegetable Bake
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper deseeded & thickly sliced
1 yellow bell pepper deseeded & thickly sliced
4 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F.
Place potatoes, onion, peppers and zucchini in a large roasting dish, toss with oil to coat and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes.
Add sausages on top of the vegetables, return to oven and bake for a further 25 minutes or until sausages are golden and cooked through.
Top with basil leaves to serve.

name: One-Pot Broccoli & Prosciutto Pasta
ingredients: 200g orecchiette pasta (or gluten free) or other pasta of choice
3 celery stalks finely diced & leaves reserved
1 tsp chilli flakes or to taste
200g broccoli cut in bite size pieces & stems in batons
preparation: Bring a large saucepan of well salted water to the boil. Add pasta and cook following packet directions, until almost cooked. Reserve 3⁄4 cup of pasta water and drain.
Put pot back over medium heat, add oil and saute celery, leek, garlic, thyme and chilli for 5 minutes.

Add reserved pasta water, cooked pasta and broccoli. Cover and cook for 3 - 4 minutes, shaking the pot over the heat a couple of times, until liquid is almost all absorbed. It should be a little saucy, but not soupy.
Reduce heat to low, add vinegar and parmesan and toss to coat evenly.
Remove from heat and stir through prosciutto and celery leaves. Season to taste and serve immediately.

name: Huevos Rancheros
ingredients: 1 tsp Mexican spice mix (a mix of ground cumin, paprika & chilli pepper) or more to taste
1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 can of kidney beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
4 small (1 ½ oz ea) wholegrain/wholewheat wraps or tortillas (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add onion, bell pepper and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until vegetables are soft.
Add spice, tomatoes and beans and simmer for a further 10 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Adjust seasoning.

Use a spoon to make enough indentations in the sauce to crack an egg in each and season with salt and pepper. Reduce heat to low, cover with a lid and cook for 5-8 minutes or until eggs are cooked to your liking.
Divide between plates and serve with avocado and warm tortillas.

name: Skillet-Braised Chicken with White Beans
ingredients: 1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Heat oil in a medium-large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes until browned.
Add onion and cook for another 5 minutes or until softened.
Add garlic and oregano and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add potatoes and chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Cover, reduce to low and simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken and potatoes are tender. Adjust seasoning.
Add beans and spinach to saucepan and cook for a few minutes until heated through.
Stir through parsley and serve.

name: Quick Beef & Root Vegetable Stew
ingredients: 2 tbs all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
preparation: Season beef with salt and pepper and dust with flour, shaking off excess.
Heat oil in a large non-stick casserole pot or saucepan over high heat. Cook beef for 5 minutes or until browned. Set aside on a plate.
Reduce heat to medium, add onion to casserole and cook for 5 minutes or until soft.
Add parsnip, carrot, potato, tomato paste, wine and stock. Bring to a simmer, cover with lid and cook for 15-20 minutes or until vegetables are just tender.
Add beef and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, for a further 5 minutes until beef is cooked and stew has thickened.
Divide between plates and top with chopped parsley to serve.

name: One-Pot Jambalaya with Shrimp & Chorizo
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper deseeded & finely diced
preparation: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Toss shrimp with oil and spice mix to coat. Working in batches, shrimp in skillet until just browned on both sides, transfer to a plate, and repeat with remaining shrimp. Set aside.
Add onion, red pepper and chorizo to skillet and cook for 5-6 minutes or until onion is soft.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add rice and stock, cover with a lid and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook for 12 minutes or until rice is tender. Adjust seasoning.
Scatter over shrimp and continue to cook covered for a few more minutes or until shrimp are just cooked through. Remove from heat and stand covered for 8-10 minutes.
Toss parsley through, squeeze over lemon and serve.

name: Southern Spicy Cauliflower Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a large baking sheet with baking paper.
Whisk together flour, nutritional yeast and milk. Season with salt and pepper and set aside for a few minutes to thicken.
Whilst oven is heating, place almonds on baking sheet and roast for 5 minutes, or until golden. Set aside.
Coat cauliflower pieces in batter and arrange on tray. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden.
Combine chickpeas, lentils, almonds and lemon juice, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Toss salad ingredients together with almonds, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Once cauliflower is cooked, heat sriracha, maple syrup and water in a large non-stick skillet until sauce begins to simmer and thicken slightly. Add baked cauliflower and toss well to coat.
Divide chickpeas and lentils, salad and cauliflower between bowls and top with scallions to serve.

name: Loaded Sweet Potato Fries
ingredients: 800g sweet potatoes peeled & sliced into 1/2 inch thick fries
3 scallions white & green part chopped separately
1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 1⁄2 tsp ground chilli or to taste
3 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F. Spray a wire rack with oil and place over a baking sheet.
Spread fries over rack, spray with oil, season with salt and pepper and cook for 15-20 minutes or until crisp and golden brown, turning halfway through.
At the same time, heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat and saute tofu, white part of the scallions and garlic for 4 minutes.
Stir through tomatoes, black beans and chilli and season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes or until mixture has reduced and thickened.
Divide fries and bean mixture between plates. Top with yogurt, remaining green scallions, cilantro and hot sauce (if using) to serve.

name: Spiced Chicken Wings with Rice & Slaw
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 tsp cayenne pepper or to taste
400g tip-free chicken wings (or a mix of wingettes & drumettes)
2 cups (320g) microwave brown rice cooked according to packet directions
2 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly torn apart
preparation: Preheat oven and a baking sheet or cast iron skillet to 355°F.
Combine spices and salt and pepper in a bowl. Spray chicken with oil and toss with spices to coat.
Remove hot sheet or skillet from oven, carefully add chicken and bake for 15-20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Meanwhile, whisk lime juice and mustard, season with salt and pepper and toss with remaining slaw ingredients.
Divide slaw and chicken between plates and serve with rice and a lime wedge.

name: Baked Feta with Peppers
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
1 yellow bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.
Heat a medium oven-proof skillet or casserole over medium heat. Spray with oil and cook onion, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft.
Add garlic and bell peppers and cook, stirring, for 8-10 minutes until tender.
Add tomatoes and lentils, season with salt and pepper and mix well.
Lay feta slices over pepper mixture and bake in the oven for 10 minutes or until feta has softened.
Scatter over parsley and extra black pepper and serve with toasted bread.

name: Chicken Burritos
ingredients: 300g skinless chicken breast cut into strips
1 1⁄2 tsp Mexican spice mix (a mix of ground cumin, paprika & chilli pepper) or to taste
1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro chopped, plus extra to serve
4 small (1 ½ oz ea) wholegrain/wholewheat wraps or tortillas (or gluten free)
preparation: Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and peppers and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes until softened.
Add chicken and cook for another 5 minutes until browned and cooked through.
Add spice, tomato sauce and beans and simmer for a few minutes or until sauce thickens. Remove from heat, season with salt and pepper and stir through cilantro. Set aside.
Wipe skillet clean and return to heat.
Spread chicken mixture down the center of each wrap, top with cheese and roll up.
Place seam-side down into the hot skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes each side until warmed through.
Cut burritos in half, transfer to serving plates and top with yogurt and extra cilantro to serve.

name: Reuben Sandwich
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free)
preparation: Combine mayonnaise and tomato ketchup, and season with salt and pepper.
Toast bread and spread each piece with combined mayonnaise. Top with cheese, corned beef, sauerkraut and dill pickle. Season and serve.
Note: This is served as 3 open sandwiches.

name: Lamb Pastitsio
ingredients: 1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 tsp dried oregano plus extra to sprinkle
180g macaroni or small elbow pasta (or gluten free)
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F.
Heat oil and onion in a large non-stick saucepan over medium heat and cook stirring, for 4-5 minutes until soft.
Add carrots and garlic and cook for another minute.
Add lamb, season with salt and pepper and cook, breaking up with a spoon, for 5 minutes or until browned.
Stir through tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano and cinnamon. Gently simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until tomatoes have broken down and sauce thickens.
Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions. Drain.
Spoon pasta evenly into a medium sized oven proof dish and carefully spoon the sauce over, smoothing the surface.
Combine yogurt and egg in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and spread over the sauce.
Scatter over extra oregano and bake for 15 minutes or until lightly golden and bubbling.

name: Butter Chicken with Rice
ingredients: 1⁄2 tsp ground chilli or to taste
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 25 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Melt butter in a large non-stick saucepan over medium heat and saute chicken for a few minutes to brown. Remove from saucepan and set aside.
Add onion to hot saucepan and saute for 4-5 minutes to soften.
Stir through carrots, garlic and spices and cook for a few more minutes, stirring to prevent sticking.
Add tomato sauce and stock, bring to the boil and simmer gently for 5 minutes.
Add chicken, return to the boil and simmer gently for 5 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. Adjust seasoning.
Remove from heat and stir through spinach and yogurt.
Divide chicken and rice between bowls and scatter with fresh cilantro to serve.

name: Grilled Fish with Spiced Rice & Lentils (Mejadra)
ingredients: 1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked & roughly chopped
preparation: Heat most of the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook, stirring, for 8-10 minutes until they are a deep golden colour. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel and return saucepan to the heat.
Add rice and spices to saucepan and stir to coat. Add water, cover and simmer on low for 15 minutes or until the rice is tender. Stir through lentils and set aside, covered, for 10 minutes.
Toss fish with remaining oil and season with salt and pepper. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook fish for 3-4 minutes each side, or until cooked through.
Add half the onions and most of the cilantro to the rice dish and mix well with a fork.
Divide rice between serving plates, top with remaining onions and cilantro and serve with fish.

name: Vegetable Pasta Bake with Ricotta
ingredients: 1 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked
1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
1⁄2 tsp chilli flakes or more to taste
1⁄3 cup (40g) parmesan plus optional extra for topping
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper and spray an 8 x 10 inch oven-proof dish with oil.
Arrange eggplant on prepared sheet, spray with oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes, turning halfway through.
Combine spinach and basil together in a bowl.

For the Mushroom Ragu: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat, spray with oil and add sliced mushrooms in a single layer. Cook for 8-10 minutes, turning once until golden. Add tomatoes, thyme, chilli, salt and pepper and simmer for 8-10 minutes to thicken sauce. Adjust seasoning and set aside.
For the Cheese Sauce: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Spread ⅓ of the cheese sauce over the base of the prepared oven dish, followed by ⅓ of the lasagna sheeets, ⅓ of mushroom ragu, ⅓ of eggplant slices, and ⅓ of the spinach and basil mix. Repeat layering twice, adding final spinach mix around the eggplant layer. Don’t worry if layers aren’t perfect - it will still taste delicious!
Sprinkle over extra parmesan (if using) and bake for 30-35 minutes or until the sauce is bubbling and eggplant is golden brown.
Stand for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Silken Tofu with Rice & Greens (Hiyayakko)
ingredients: 1 bunch of baby bok choy (buk, pak or puk choy)(5 oz bunch) halved lengthways, washed & end trimmed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
500g silken tofu drained & cut into 6 pieces
2 tbs light soy sauce (or gluten-free equivalent)
preparation: Combine dressing ingredients together in a small bowl or jar.
Place bok choy in a steamer and steam over a saucepan of gently simmering water for 2-3 minutes.
At the same time, cook rice according to packet directions and toss with lentils and defrosted edamame.
Divide rice, tofu and bok choy between plates. Drizzle over dressing and scatter with sesame seeds to serve.

name: Easy Chicken Parmesan with Sweet Potato Fries & Salad
ingredients: 2 tbs all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
2 sprigs of parsley leaves picked & roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line 2 baking sheets with baking paper.
Toss potatoes with oil, season with salt and pepper and transfer to one prepared sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and tender.
Meanwhile, evenly cut chicken fillets horizontally to create two thinner pieces per breast and season with salt and pepper.

Place flour, egg and breadcrumbs in three separate bowls. Dust chicken with flour, shaking off excess, then egg, allowing excess to run off, and finally press both sides firmly into breadcrumbs to coat.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Lightly spray crumbed chicken pieces with oil and cook for 3 minutes each side, until golden and cooked through.
Place cooked chicken on second sheet and top with tomato sauce and cheese. Return to oven for a few minutes, or place under a preheated broiler, until cheese has melted and beginning to brown.
Scatter parsley over chicken and serve with sweet potato fries and salad leaves on the side.

name: Chicken Adobo with Rice
ingredients: 5 scallions thinly sliced, plus extra to serve
1⁄2 cup (125ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 1⁄2 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 35 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Heat oil in a non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and scallions and cook for a minute or until fragrant.
Add chicken and brown on both sides to seal.
Add vinegar, soy, bay leaves and maple syrup, cover and gently simmer chicken for 20 minutes, turning chicken over halfway through, until chicken is tender.
Remove chicken pieces from sauce and keep in a warm place. Discard bay leaves and gently simmer sauce for 6-8 minutes or until thick and slightly sticky.
Divide rice between serving plates and top with chicken and sauce. Scatter over extra scallions and serve with sliced cucumber.

name: Beef Ragu Stuffed Shells
ingredients: 1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 tsp dried oregano or 2 tsp chopped fresh (or more to taste)
180g conchiglioni, large dried pasta shells (or gluten free)
preparation: Heat oil in a large non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 4-5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Add beef, season with salt and pepper and cook, breaking up any clumps with a fork, for 5 minutes or until browned.

Stir through tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano and water and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes or until tomatoes have broken down and sauce thickens. Adjust seasoning.
Preheat oven to 390°F.
Meanwhile, cook pasta shells in a large saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions. Drain.
Ladle a cup of sauce into the base of a 8 x 12 inch baking dish.
Fill each shell with sauce and transfer to the baking dish.
Spoon over any remaining sauce, scatter over mozzarella and bake for 15 minutes or until sauce is bubbling and cheese has melted.
Scatter over extra oregano leaves if using, and serve with salad leaves tossed with lemon juice.

name: Spinach & Ricotta Stuffed Shells
ingredients: 1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
4 sprigs of fresh basil leaves torn, plus extra to serve
180g conchiglioni, large dried pasta shells (or gluten free)
preparation: Heat oil in a large non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 4-5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and cook for another minute.

Stir through tomatoes and water and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until tomatoes have broken down and sauce thickens. Adjust seasoning and stir through basil.
Meanwhile, cook pasta shells in a large saucepan of salted boiling water according to the packet instructions. Drain.
Place spinach in a heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Stand for a minute until wilted. Drain and refresh under cold water. Squeeze out as much water as you can then finely chop.
In a medium bowl, mix wilted spinach, ricotta and eggs and season with salt and pepper.
Preheat oven to 390°F.
Ladle a cup of tomato sauce into the base of an 8 x 12 inch baking dish.
Fill each shell with ricotta mixture and transfer to the baking dish.
Spoon over remaining tomato sauce, scatter over mozzarella and bake for 15 minutes or until sauce is bubbling and cheese has melted.
Serve topped with extra basil leaves.

name: Minestrone with Broken Pasta
ingredients: 1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
1⁄2 cup (100g) dried green lentils well rinsed
1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion and carrot for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add tomatoes, lentils, stock and bay leaf, cover and simmer for 15 - 20 minutes or until vegetables and lentils are beginning to soften.
Add pasta and cook according to packet instructions. If soup is too thick, you may need to add a little more stock.
Add beans and spinach and cook for another 2 minutes until warmed through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Divide soup between serving bowls and scatter over parmesan to serve.

name: Ponzu Beef Stir-Fry
ingredients: 500g beef strips thinly sliced against the grain
2 scallions white & green thinly sliced separately
1⁄2 red bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
1 bunch of baby bok choy (buk, pak or puk choy)(5 oz bunch) quartered
2 1⁄4 cups (360g) microwave brown rice cooked according to packet directions
3 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Whisk sauce ingredients together and set aside.
Pat steak dry with paper towel. Toss with half the oil and season with salt and pepper.

Heat a wok or large skillet over very high heat. Add half of the steak at a time to sear, tossing occasionally, for 5–6 minutes until browned. Transfer to a plate and repeat with the remaining meat, then set aside.
Reduce the heat to medium-high, add remaining oil, white part of scallion, ginger, garlic, carrot and bell pepper to the wok and stir-fry for about 3 minutes until beginning to soften.
Add zucchini and bok choy and cook for a further 3 minutes until the bok choy leaves begin to soften and turn bright green.
Return steak to the wok, add sauce and toss well to combine. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat and cook for a few minutes more.
Divide rice and stir-fry between bowls and top with the green part of scallion, cilantro and chilli flakes (if using).

name: Skillet Eggplant Lasagna
ingredients: 200g fresh lasagna sheets (or gluten free) torn into wide strips
1⁄4 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) plus extra to serve, leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.
Heat a large oven-proof skillet over medium heat.
Add eggplant and water, cover with lid and simmer for 15 minutes or until eggplant is tender. Remove the lid and simmer until water has evaporated.
Make some room in the bottom of the skillet and add the oil and garlic. Sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add tomato puree and bring to a simmer.
Add lasagna sheets and basil to the eggplant and gently stir to combine, ensuring pasta is submerged in sauce.
Combine ricotta, eggs, half the parmesan and season with salt and pepper.
Add spoonfuls of ricotta mixture to the lasagna and sprinkle remaining parmesan on top. Cover with an oven proof lid or foil and bake for 15 minutes.
Uncover and bake for a further 15 minutes until pasta is cooked and cheese is golden.
Divide lasagna between plates and scatter over extra basil leaves to serve.

name: Spicy Moroccan Chicken Bowl
ingredients: 3 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked, plus extra to serve
1⁄2 cup (90g) couscous (or gluten free couscous or cooked brown rice if gluten free)
preparation: Mix spices together with salt and pepper in a small bowl.
Heat half the oil in a large skillet over medium–high heat. Add chicken and half the spice mix and cook for about 5 minutes to brown both sides. Set aside.
Add remaining oil to the skillet and saute onion, garlic, bell pepper and carrot for 4–5 minutes.
Add remaining spice mix and sauté for another 15 seconds, stirring constantly.

Return chicken to the skillet and stir through tomato paste, stock and chickpeas. Bring to the boil, reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Remove from heat and stir through lime zest, juice and cilantro leaves.
At the same time place couscous in a heat proof bowl and add boiling water. Cover with cling film or a lid and set aside for 5-8 minutes.
Fluff couscous with a fork and divide between serving bowls. Add chicken and vegetables and top with crumbled cheese, pistachios and extra cilantro leaves to serve.

name: Tuna & Broccoli Casserole
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup panko breadcrumbs (or gluten-free if required)
6 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves stripped (optional)
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F.
Cook pasta in a large saucepan of salted boiling water for half the recommended cooking time.
Add broccoli to the saucepan of pasta and cook for a further 2 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Heat a medium sized non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 5 minutes, stirring, until soft.
Add garlic and cook for a further minute until fragrant.

In a small bowl, blend cornstarch with sufficient stock to form a smooth paste. Stir through cooked onion for a minute. Gradually add remaining stock and milk and cook, stirring continuously, until thickened. (You may need to add a little more stock if too thick)
Gently stir sauce through tuna, pasta and broccoli and adjust seasoning.
Transfer to an 8 inch baking dish and scatter over mozzarella and breadcrumbs.
Bake casserole for 15 minutes or until golden. Scatter over thyme leaves (if using) to serve.

name: Skillet Sausage & White Bean Bake
ingredients: 1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked (optional)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.
Place tomatoes in a large oven proof dish or skillet. Rinse the empty can with the water and add to the dish.
Add beans, stock and garlic, season with salt and pepper and stir to combine.

Gently nestle sausages and potatoes into the dish and bake for 45 minutes or until potatoes are cooked and sausages are golden brown. (You may need to add a little more stock or water whilst cooking, depending on the size of your dish.)
Just before serving, place spinach and a pinch of salt in a bowl, cover with boiling water and set aside for a few minutes to wilt. Drain well and squeeze over lemon juice.
Dollop pesto over sausages, top with basil leaves (if using) and serve with wilted spinach.

name: Simple Pepperoni Pizza
ingredients: 2 small (2 oz ea) wholewheat pita bread or pockets (or gluten free)
1⁄2 red bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
1⁄2 green bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked (optional)
preparation: Preheat oven and a pizza stone or baking sheet to 390°F
Place pita breads on baking paper and spread with tomato puree, leaving a 1 inch border.
Scatter over half the cheese, top with bell peppers, onion and remaining cheese. Arrange pepperoni over the top and season with salt and pepper.
Carefully remove the baking sheet or stone from the oven and transfer baking paper with pizza to the sheet/stone.
Transfer to the oven and bake for 10 minutes until crisp.
Cut into slices, scatter over basil and serve immediately with salad leaves tossed with lemon juice.

name: Super Greens Pizza
ingredients: 1 large (3 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita bread or pocket (or gluten free)
250g broccoli cut in florets & thinly sliced
preparation: Preheat oven and a pizza stone or baking sheet to 390°F.
Place spinach in a sieve and pour boiling water over to wilt. Quickly rinse under cold water and squeeze out excess water with your hands.
Place pita on baking paper and spread with ricotta, leaving a 1 inch border.
Top with broccoli and mozzarella and scatter over spinach and sliced chilli. Season with salt and pepper.
Carefully remove baking sheet or stone from the oven and transfer baking paper with pizza to the sheet/stone.
Bake for 10 minutes until crisp.
Cut into slices and serve immediately.

name: Roasted Chicken, Pear & Almond Salad
ingredients: 1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 1⁄2 cups (270g) pre-cooked quinoa cooked according to packet directions
1 sprig of fresh basil leaves picked
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and heat an oven-proof skillet over medium heat.
Rub chicken with oil and season with salt and pepper.

Add chicken to hot skillet and sear one side for 5 minutes. Turn and transfer skillet to the hot oven and roast chicken for another 5 minutes or until cooked through. Rest for a few minutes before slicing.
Whilst chicken is cooking, combine dressing ingredients and season with salt and pepper.
Gently toss lentils, quinoa, pear and spinach leaves, season and divide between bowls.
Add sliced chicken, chopped almonds, basil leaves and drizzle over dressing to serve.

name: Baked Salmon with Kale
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves stripped & torn
2 1⁄2 cups (400g) microwave brown rice and quinoa heated according to packet instructions
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F.
Spray a large piece of foil with oil.
Place salmon in the center, pour over lemon juice and scatter over dill.
Add kale and season the parcel with salt and pepper.
Bring sides of the foil together, scrunching to seal and bake for 15-20 minutes or until salmon flakes apart. Don't overcook it.
Divide quinoa mix, salmon and kale between serving plates and drizzle over any juices.

name: Cajun Lentil Burger
ingredients: 1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 tbs chickpea flour (besan) or plain flour
2 small (1 3/4oz) wholegrain/wholewheat (or gluten free) rolls cut in half
preparation: Place lentils in a large bowl and roughly mash with a fork, leaving some whole.
Add mushrooms, flour, spice, salt and pepper. Mix well until mixture holds together and form into patties.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add patties and cook for 3 minutes each side until golden and crisp.
Spread base of rolls with mayonnaise and top with pickles, spinach, pattie and tomato. Season with salt and pepper and finish with remaining half of roll to serve.

name: Weeknight Pesto & Ricotta Spaghetti
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (60g) parmesan grated, reserve some for serving
1 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked, reserve some for serving
preparation: Bring a large pot of salted water to the boil.
At the same time heat a non-stick skillet over low heat and toast pine nuts for 2-3 minutes or until just becoming golden and fragrant. Scatter over a plate to cool.
Add parmesan, garlic, basil leaves, chilli and cooled pine nuts to a blender. With the machine running, slowly add stock until mixture just comes together. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add pasta to boiling water and cook according to packet instructions.
Once pasta is cooked, reserve 1⁄4 cup of pasta water and drain.
Return pasta to the pot and toss with zucchini noodles to combine.
Add pesto and sufficient reserved pasta water to make a sauce and mix well.
Divide between bowls and top with ricotta, parmesan and extra basil leaves to serve.

name: Thai Chicken, Chilli & Cashew Stir-Fry
ingredients: 550g skinless chicken thighs (fully trimmed) cut in 1 inch strips
1 red bell pepper deseeded, quartered & cut in strips
1 tbs light soy sauce (or gluten-free equivalent)
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Heat wok over medium heat, add cashews and toss for a few minutes until golden brown. Set aside.
Turn heat to high and add oil, chicken and garlic and stir-fry until golden brown.
Add bell pepper and onion, toss and cook for a few minutes.
Add stock and sauces and continue to cook until chicken is cooked through and sauce has reduced and thickened.
Turn off heat, add scallions and cashews and toss well.
Divide stir-fry and rice between bowls and serve immediately.

name: Salmon Fish Cakes
ingredients: 350g salmon in springwater drained & forked apart
4 sprigs of dill chopped, plus extra to serve
lemon ½ juiced & ½ cut in wedges
4 small (1 ½ oz ea) wholegrain/wholewheat wraps or tortillas (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Cook potato in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 10 minutes, or until tender.
Add peas and cook for a further 1-2 minutes. Drain and return vegetables to saucepan and mash.
Stir through salmon and dill and season with salt and pepper.
Form into even sized patties and coat in breadcrumbs.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook patties for 3 minutes each side, or until golden.
Toss spinach, oil and lemon juice together and season with salt and pepper.
Divide fish cakes between plates and serve with salad, warm wraps, yogurt, lemon wedges and extra dill.

name: Butternut Squash & Hazelnut Pasta Bake
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and grease an oven proof dish with a little oil.
Dice squash and steam for 5-10 minutes until tender or grate and microwave, covered, for 3 minutes on high and mash.
Cook pasta in salted, boiling water until just 2 minutes shy of what the package instructions indicate. Drain, reserving 1⁄2 cup of pasta water, and set aside.
In a large saucepan or stock pot over medium-low heat, add oil and sauté onion and garlic until translucent, about 5 minutes.
At the same time, puree cooked squash (or canned pumpkin puree if using), tofu, milk, cumin, paprika, mustard powder and reserved pasta water and season with salt and pepper.
Stir kale, squash puree and onion mixture through drained pasta to combine. Adjust seasoning and spices to taste.
Transfer to prepared baking dish, scatter over hazelnuts and bake for 20 minutes or until golden and fragrant.
Divide between plates and scatter over parsley to serve.

name: Falafel Burger
ingredients: 2 cans of chickpeas (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
4 medium (2 1/2oz) wholegrain/wholewheat (or gluten free)rolls cut in half
1 sprig of fresh mint leaves picked & shredded
preparation: Preheat the oven to 430°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Make the chia ‘eggs’ by combining chia seeds and water and set aside for 5 minutes to thicken.
Process chickpeas, tempeh and walnuts in a food processor on low for 1-2 mins to combine but still remain chunky.
Transfer mixture to a bowl and combine with chia mixture, spices, salt, garlic, cilantro and half the flour. Mix thoroughly then add the remainder of the flour, kneading gently to form patties.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat, add oil and cook patties for 3-4 minutes each side to brown.
Transfer to sheet and bake for 15 minutes. Add rolls in the last 3 minutes to toast.
To serve, spread buns with hummus and layer with lettuce, patty, tomato, dill pickle and mint.

name: Pork Fillet Rice Bowl
ingredients: 1 bunch of baby bok choy (buk, pak or puk choy)(5 oz bunch) cut in half lenghtways
2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 cup sauerkraut or other fermented vegetables
2 sprigs of Thai basil or coriander
preparation: Place rice and water in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cook for 25-30 minutes, remove from heat and rest for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork. Keep covered and set aside.

Meanwhile, season the pork fillet generously with salt and pepper. Heat a non-stick skillet over high heat and sear pork, around 2 minutes on each side. Reduce skillet heat to medium and continue to cook pork for a further 3 minutes more on each side. Remove from pan and rest loosely covered to keep warm. Slice just prior to serving.

Without cleaning the skillet, add the water and bring to the boil. Add bok choy, cover and cook for 2 minutes. Quickly strain water off, return skillet to heat and toss with half the sesame oil. Season to taste.
Toss cooked rice with remaining sesame oil, soy sauce, vinegar, maple syrup and ginger and mix well with a fork.
Divide rice and pork between bowls and top with bok choy, sauerkraut, herbs and pepitas to serve.

name: Spelt Spaghetti with Seafood
ingredients: 2 cayenne chilli peppers seeds optional & chopped
250g cherry tomatoes multi-colored, if available & halved
450g uncooked seafood mix (eg mussels, shrimp, calamari)
2 cups (60g) arugula plus extra to garnish
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil. Add spaghetti and cook according to packet instructions. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain spaghetti.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, add garlic and chilli peppers and cook for a minute.
Add tomatoes, season and cook for a few minutes until they break down.
Add seafood and sear for a few minutes.
Add wine, cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for a couple more minutes or until seafood is just cooked.
Take skillet off heat, add cooked pasta, lemon juice, arugula and pasta water if needed to loosen and season with salt and pepper.
Divide between bowls, top with extra arugula and lemon zest (and parmesan if using) and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Chicken Ratatouille Bake
ingredients: 350g skinless chicken breast 2 x 6 oz fillets
1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 sprig of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.
Heat a non-stick skillet over high heat. Spray chicken with oil, season with salt and pepper and sear on both sides for a minute to brown. Set aside on a plate.
Add oil and sauté onion for 2 minutes to soften.
Add eggplant and continue to cook for 5 minutes, tossing regularly.
Add zucchini and garlic and cook another 5 minutes or until eggplant is beginning to soften. Stir through tomatoes, chickpeas, vinegar and chilli flakes and season to taste.
Transfer to an oven proof dish, add chicken and bake for 12-15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Divide between plates, top with basil leaves to serve and serve with baguette.

name: Moroccan Vegetable Stew
ingredients: 2 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
2 cans of chickpeas (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and spice and cook for a further minute until fragrant.
Stir through lentils, carrot, bell pepper, tomato and stock. Cook, covered, for 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Add chickpeas and cook for a further 5 minutes. Season to taste.
Divide rice and stew between bowls and top with yogurt and cilantro to serve.

name: Baked Sweet Potato Chilli
ingredients: 1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss sweet potato with oil and bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden.
Transfer to a large bowl and mix with remaining ingredients, except yogurt.
Place mixture in an oven-proof dish, cover with foil and bake for 20 - 25 minutes. Adjust seasoning.
Divide between bowls and serve with yogurt.

name: Turkey Meatloaf
ingredients: 2 cups (200g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Preheat oven to 430°F and brush a 9 x 4 inch loaf pan with a little oil.
Heat a skillet over medium heat, add oil and all the vegetables and saute for 10 minutes or until softened.
Transfer to a large bowl and add turkey, egg white, oats, salt, pepper and herbs and mix well with hands.

Place mixture in loaf tin and tap on the bench to release any air pockets. Bake for 35  minutes or until cooked through.  (Check by inserting a skewer in the center and if it comes out clean and is warm to the touch, it’s done.) Allow to cool slightly then slice.
Toss salad leaves with lemon juice, divide between plates and serve with meatloaf.

name: Honey Mustard Roast Chicken with Broccolini
ingredients: 1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) trimmed
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a small roasting dish with baking paper.
Combine butter, mustard and honey in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper.

Loosen the chicken skin with your fingers and spread mixture evenly under the skin. Transfer to dish, season with salt and pepper and roast for 35-40 minutes, basting occasionally, until cooked through. Rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Meanwhile, cook potatoes in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 10 minutes until almost cooked. Add broccolini and cook for a further 2-3 minutes until crisp-tender. Drain.
Divide chicken, potatoes and broccolini between plates and drizzle any pan juices over chicken to serve.

name: Simple Salmon with Herb Sauce
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) finely chopped
1 garlic clove grated into a fine paste
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a shallow baking dish with baking paper.
Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Place salmon in prepared dish, season well with salt and pepper and roast for 13-15 minutes or until salmon is cooked to your liking.
While salmon roasts, combine sauce ingredients in a small bowl and season to taste.
Toss salad ingredients together in a bowl.
Divide rice and salmon between plates. Drizzle sauce over salmon, serve with salad and a wedge of lemon.

name: Spicy Chicken Pho
ingredients: 3 scallions white & green part chopped separately
1⁄4 cup soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
2 limes one juiced & one cut in wedges
1 bunch of baby bok choy (buk, pak or puk choy)(5 oz bunch) cut in quarters lengthwise
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: In a large saucepan or stock pot over medium-low heat, add oil and sauté white part of scallions for 3 minutes.
Add ginger, garlic and half the chilli and sauté a few more minutes. Add spices, season with salt and pepper and stir to coat.
Add stock and simmer, covered for 10 minutes.
Add chicken breast and continue to cook for 15 minutes. Remove chicken and set aside to cool slightly, then shred with two forks.

Whilst chicken is cooking, bring a saucepan of water to the boil. Add noodles, stirring well to separate and cook for 2-3 minutes until just cooked. Drain and rinse with cold water, if not using immediately to prevent them from sticking together.
Strain broth into another pot, discarding or composting the ‘whole’ ingredients and bring to a simmer.
Turn off the heat and add soy sauce, fish sauce and lime juice and adjust seasoning.
Divide noodles, chicken and uncooked bok choy between bowls and ladle over the hot broth.
Top with bean shoots, cilantro leaves, green part of scallions, froed shallots, extra chilli (if using) and serve with lime wedges.

name: Pea & Ham Soup
ingredients: 2 1⁄2 cups (100g) baby spinach leaves or watercress
4 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and saute onion and celery for a few minutes to soften.
Add potatoes, ham hock and stock. You may need to add a little water to cover the hock. Bring to a boil, reduce to a low simmer, cover and cook for 50-60 minutes until ham is very tender.
Remove hock from soup and skim off any fat from the surface. Shred meat from the bones, discarding the bones, and roughly chop meat. Set aside.
Add peas and most of the spinach to soup and simmer for a few minutes until peas are tender. Use a stick blender and blend until smooth. Adjust seasoning.
Ladle soup into bowls, top with ham and extra spinach leaves (or watercress if using). Season with extra black pepper and serve with toast.

name: Beef Panzanella Salad
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper deseeded & thickly sliced
4 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted & torn
3 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Heat a BBQ or non-stick griddle pan over medium-high heat.
Rub beef with a little oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 2-3 minutes each side, or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to plate and rest in a warm place for 5 minutes before slicing.
Add bell pepper to the BBQ and cook for 4-5 minutes until charred and tender. Remove from heat.
Whisk vinegar and remaining oil in a large bowl to combine.
Add arugula, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, olives, sourdough, steak, bell pepper and basil leaves and gently toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide between plates and serve.

name: BBQ Shrimp with Herb Rice Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat griddle pan over medium heat.
Add shrimp to a large bowl and toss with oil, spices and salt and pepper to coat and set aside.
Prepare herb salad by tossing all ingredients together in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Add shrimp to hot skillet in a single layer and cook, without turning for about 3-4 minutes. Turn and cook for another 30 seconds to 1 minute.
Divide shrimp and salad between plates and serve with a slice of lime.

name: Colorful Vegetable Gratin
ingredients: 6 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves stripped
200g roasted red bell peppers, in brine drained
1⁄2 cup (70g) panko breadcrumbs (or gluten-free if required)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and grease a deep pie dish.
Layer potatoes in the base, add quarter of the stock, season with salt and pepper and scatter over some thyme.
Repeat the same process with the sweet potato, turnip and squash layers.
Add roasted peppers.
In a medium bowl, combine ricotta, feta and egg until smooth. Season with salt and pepper and spread over the peppers.
Cover with baking paper and foil and bake for 45 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Combine topping ingredients and season with salt & pepper. Scatter over the cheese layer and return to oven for 10 minutes or until lightly golden on top.
Divide between plates to serve.

name: Spicy Pork Salad Bowl
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
1⁄2 tsp chilli flakes or more depending on taste
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained, rinsed & dried
1 Lebanese cucumber thinly sliced into rounds
2 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes. Spread on a plate to cool.
Meanwhile, heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook for 4-5 minutes until almost cooked.
Add garlic, spice, chilli and season with salt and pepper. Cook for another minute until fragrant. Remove from heat.
At the same time, toss chickpeas with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Divide rice, pork, chickpeas, bell pepper and cucumber between serving bowls. Top with yogurt and cilantro to serve.

name: Herb-Spiced Fish & Chips
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Toss sweet potato with half the oil, season with salt and pepper and roast for 30 minutes or until tender inside and crispy outside. (You can place potatoes on a wire rack on the sheet to get maximum air circulation for a crispier chip.)
Combine seasoning ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.

Just before chips are cooked, heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Rub fish with remaining oil and season with salt and pepper. Sear fish on one side in the hot skillet for 4-5 minutes, flip and sear on the other side for a few minutes and transfer to serving plates.
Whilst fish is cooking, toss salad leaves with lemon juice, season with salt and pepper and divide between plates.
Add fish, season with spice mix and serve with chips and tzatziki.

name: Slow-Cooked Whole Cauliflower with Yellow Curry & Quinoa
ingredients: 1 cup (180g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1 head of cauliflower (2 lb head) leaves trimmed
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
preparation: Blend cornstarch with a little of the stock to a smooth paste. Stir through curry paste and coconut cream to combine, add remainder of stock and season with salt and pepper.
Toss quinoa, zucchini and bell pepper in the slow cooker. Add whole cauliflower and pour over sauce.
Cook on high for 3-4 hours (or on low for 6-8 hours), until cauliflower is tender.
Whilst cauliflower is cooking, heat a small skillet over medium heat and toast almonds for a few minutes until golden brown.
Divide cauliflower and sauce between plates and top with yogurt, toasted almonds and cilantro to serve.

name: Cajun Grilled Chicken Salad
ingredients: 1 cup (180g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1 head of baby romaine lettuce shredded
6 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked
preparation: Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Simmer, covered for 12-15 minutes or until cooked, rest covered for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork to serve.
At the same time, preheat a large non-stick griddle pan or BBQ to medium-high heat.
Grill corn, turning, for 8-10 minutes until lightly charred and cooked. Remove from heat and allow to cool slightly before slicing off the kernels.
Coat chicken in spice and lightly spray with oil. Grill for 4-5 minutes, turning, until cooked through. Set aside to rest for 2 minutes before slicing.
Divide lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, onion and quinoa between bowls. Add chicken and corn.
Squeeze over lime juice, season with salt and pepper and serve topped with cilantro.

name: Slow-Cooked South Western Beef Stew
ingredients: 1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
preparation: Combine sauce ingredients in the slow cooker.
Add beef, potato and onion and gently stir to combine.
Cook for 6-8 hours on low (or 3-4 hours on high), adding corn & fava beans for the last 30 minutes.
Divide between bowls and top with fresh parsley to serve.

name: Slow-Cooked Moroccan Chicken
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 cup (90g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: Combine all ingredients in the slow cooker and cook on high for 3-4 hours (or on low for 6-8 hours) or until chicken is cooked and sauce has thickened.
Check seasoning and divide between bowls. Scatter over reserved cilantro leaves to serve.

name: Colombian Chicken Soup (Ajiaco)
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion and carrot for 5 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Add stock and sweet potato and bring to the boil.
Add chicken and simmer for 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Transfer chicken to a board, rest for 5 minutes then slice.
Add corn to soup and cook for a few minutes.
Return chicken to the soup, remove from heat and season with salt and pepper.
Divide soup between bowls and top with chilli and cilantro to serve.

name: Slow-Cooked Chicken & Bean Soup
ingredients: 2 cans of kidney beans (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
3 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
preparation: Place ingredients in the slow cooker and mix well to combine.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours or until chicken is cooked through (or on high for 3-4 hours).
Remove chicken, shred with two forks and return to the soup.
Adjust seasoning and divide between bowls.
Top with avocado and cilantro to serve.

name: Slow-Cooker Hearty Chicken & Root Vegetable Soup
ingredients: 2 kale leaves leaves stripped from stalk & finely shredded
preparation: Saute leek, carrot, celery, garlic in oil in a medium skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes or until soft.
Transfer to the slow cooker and add remaining ingredients. Cook for 3 hours on high (or 6-8 hours on low).
Once chicken is cooked, remove and shred with two forks. Return to soup, season and serve.

name: Slow-Cooker Vegetable Risotto
preparation: Heat a medium skillet over medium heat and saute onion, mushrooms and garlic in the oil for 5 minutes or until slightly translucent.
Add rice and stir for about 3 minutes to coat with oil.

Transfer to the slow cooker, add vegetables and stock and mix well. Cook on high for 45 minutes - 1 hour (or on low for 90 minutes - 2 hours), or until the rice is al dente - a little firm to the bite.
Stir through lemon juice, adjust seasoning and divide between bowls. Scatter over parmesan to serve.

name: Roasted Turkey, Mashed Potato & Greens
ingredients: 1kg butternut squash cut in 1 inch slices
1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 bunch of English spinach (14 oz bunch) trimmed & washed
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking dish with baking paper.
Mix half the oil with the spices and salt and pepper. Massage over the turkey and place in baking dish. ‘Tent’ a piece of foil loosely over the turkey and roast for 1 hour.

After 1 hour, add squash to the dish and brush both squash and turkey with a little more oil. Continue to bake, uncovered for another 20-30 minutes until cooked and turkey juices run clear and squash is cooked. (Or a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part registers 165°F). Set aside to rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
At the same time, place potatoes in a saucepan of cold, salted water and bring to the boil. Cook for 30 minutes or until fork-tender.
Drain potatoes and return to the saucepan. Add remaining oil, milk, garlic powder, salt and pepper and mash until fluffy.  Keep warm until ready to serve.
Bring a saucepan of salted water to the boil. Add spinach, stems first, and cook for 30-40 seconds until just wilted, drain immediately.
Divide turkey, squash, mash and spinach between plates and top with chives to serve.

name: Shrimp Po’ Boy Bowl
ingredients: 300g sourdough baguette (or gluten free) thinly sliced
450g shelled raw shrimp deveined & tails still attached
1⁄4 tsp cayenne pepper or less to taste
1 bunch of (160g) asparagus trimmed & cut into thirds
1 head of baby romaine lettuce thinly sliced
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a rimmed baking sheet with baking paper.
Place baguette slices on sheet in a single layer and bake for 3-4 minutes, or until lightly golden and crunchy. Transfer bread to cooling rack.
Meanwhile, place shrimp in a bowl and toss with half the oil, spices and salt and pepper to coat. Arrange on one side of the sheet.
Toss asparagus with remaining oil, season with salt and arrange on the other side of the sheet.
Roast for 8-10 minutes or until shrimp are cooked and asparagus is tender.
To assemble, divide lettuce, tomato and avocado between bowls. Add toasted baguette, shrimp and asparagus. Squeeze over lemon and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Spicy Chilli Chicken Burger with Slaw
ingredients: 1 Lebanese cucumber thinly sliced into strips
4 medium (2 1/2oz) wholegrain/wholewheat (or gluten free)rolls cut in half
2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place cabbage, cucumber and vinegar in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
To make chilli sauce, place all ingredients in a bowl and whisk to combine. Season with pepper and set aside.
Season chicken with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken for 8-10 minutes, turning half way, until golden and cooked through.
Place chicken in chilli sauce and toss to coat.
To assemble, divide slaw between bases of each roll. Add chicken and drizzle with extra sauce. Top with the other half of the roll and serve.

name: Blackened Chicken with Umami Broccoli Rice
ingredients: 1⁄2 head of broccoli (12 oz head) chopped
3 tsp black pepper or to taste
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a shallow baking dish with baking paper.
Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Toss broccoli, parmesan, almond meal, garlic powder and salt and pepper together in a bowl. Arrange in dish and bake for 20-25 minutes or until just cooked.
At the same time, combine black pepper, paprika, onion powder and salt in a bowl. Rub spice blend all over the chicken.
Heat oil in a non-stick oven-proof skillet. Add chicken and cook for 3-4 minutes or until chicken is becoming golden.
Turn chicken and place skillet in the oven to cook for a further 12-15 minutes.
Toss broccoli and rice together.
Divide chicken and broccoli-rice between bowls to serve.

name: Sweet Potato & Bean Hot Pot
ingredients: 1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of kidney beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) sprigs roughly chopped, plus extra to serve
1 1⁄2 cups (240g) microwave brown rice heated according to packet instructions
preparation: Place oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, add onion and bell pepper and cook for 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cumin and cook, stirring for another minute.
Stir through tomatoes, stock and sweet potato, cover and cook for 25 minutes or until sweet potato is cooked through.
Add lentils, kidney beans, season to taste, and cook for a further 5 minutes. Stir through cilantro.
Divide rice and hotpot between bowls and top with extra cilantro to serve.

name: Sheet-Pan Fish & Potato Green Curry
ingredients: 450g barramundi fillets (or other firm white fish) cut into pieces
3 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
2 medium (2 1/2 oz ea) naan bread (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F.
Whisk stock, coconut milk and curry paste together until well blended.
Scatter potatoes and bell pepper in the bottom of a deep medium-sized baking tray or dish and pour over curry-coconut milk mixture. Cover tightly with foil and bake for 20 minutes.
Season fish pieces with salt and pepper and add to potatoes. Layer over remaining vegetables, cover and continue to cook for another 20 minutes, or until cooked to your liking.
Divide fish and vegetables between bowls, top with cilantro and serve with warm naan bread.

name: Teriyaki Glazed Chicken Sushi Bowl
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 1⁄2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 tbs sesame oil or olive oil
3 cups (480g) microwave brown rice heated according to packet instructions
preparation: Place sesame seeds in a non-stick skillet over low-medium heat and toast for 1-2 minutes until golden and set aside.
Combine both sauces, honey and ginger in a medium sized bowl. Add chicken and toss to coat.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Drain chicken, shaking off excess and add to pan. Cook, turning, for 6-8 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Divide heated rice, chicken and cucumber between bowls. Top with nori, scallion and toasted sesame seeds to serve.

name: Indian Lamb Pilaf
preparation: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes or until soft. Add ginger and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add lamb and cook for 4-5 minutes to brown.
Add curry powder, rice and stock. Cover, bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 10 minutes or until rice is tender.
Scatter over peas and spinach, cover with lid and set aside for 5 minutes to rest and heat through. Toss to combine and adjust seasoning.
Divide between bowls and serve topped with yogurt.

name: Southern-Style Chicken Burger Bowls
ingredients: 1 tbs all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
2 dill pickles cut in half lengthways
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss potatoes with half the oil, season with salt and pepper and scatter over sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden and tender.
Meanwhile, whisk flour, spice and salt and pepper together in a bowl. Toss with chicken and shake off excess.
Heat remaining oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through.
Whisk together mayonnaise and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Arrange cabbage, tomato and pickles in bowls and top with chicken and lemon wedges. Serve with dressing and fries.

name: Grilled Trout with Barley, Peppers & Mushrooms
ingredients: 1 1⁄4 cups (250g) pearl barley soaked overnight (or quinoa if gluten-free)
1 red bell pepper deseeded & roughly diced
450g trout fillets 2 x 5 oz skin on fillets (or salmon if not available)
2 sprigs of dill leaves picked & roughly chopped (or other fresh soft herbs)
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked & roughly chopped (or other fresh soft herbs)
preparation: Place barley (or quinoa) and water in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 15 minutes. Set aside.
Heat oil in a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat, add vegetables and sauté for 4 - 6 minutes or until golden. Season to taste.

Heat a grill pan (or skillet) over high heat. Season trout on both sides and cook for 2 minutes each side. Lower heat and continue to cook for another minute on each side. Turn off heat and let fish rest in the grill pan.
Loosen the barley with a fork and toss with vegetables and any pan juices. Adjust seasoning.
Divide barley mix between bowls and top with trout.
Squeeze over lemon and scatter over fresh herbs to serve.

name: Indian Lentil Pilaf
ingredients: 2 cans of lentils (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
preparation: Heat oil in a non-stick medium sized saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 10 minutes or until soft and caramelized.
Add ginger and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add curry powder, rice and stock. Bring to a gentle simmer, cover and cook for 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heat.
Stir through lentils and peas, cover and set aside for 5 minutes to warm through. Adjust seasoning.
Divide between bowls, top with cashews and serve with yogurt.

name: Baked Salmon with Peas & Quinoa
ingredients: 1 1⁄4 cups (225g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 430°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered for 12 minutes.
Scatter peas over quinoa, return lid and continue to cook for a further 3 minutes, or until quinoa is cooked. Rest covered for 5 minutes then fluff with a fork.
Meanwhile, press lemon zest into salmon and season with salt and pepper. Arrange on sheet and roast for 6-8 minutes or until just cooked.
At the same time, toss quinoa with lemon juice, feta and mint and adjust seasoning.
Divide quinoa between plates and top with salmon and extra mint leaves to serve.

name: Beef Char Kway Teow
ingredients: 550g beef sirloin cut into thin strips
1 1⁄2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 bunch of baby bok choy (buk, pak or puk choy)(5 oz bunch) cut in quarters lengthwise
preparation: Cook noodles according to packet instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a non-stick wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic, ginger and beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned.
Add both sauces and bok choy and toss for 2 minutes or until bok choy has just begun to wilt.
Add noodles, stirring to warm through.
Stir through bean shoots and divide between bowls. Squeeze over lemon and scatter sesame seeds to serve.

name: Chickpea Braise with Feta & Dates
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) stalks & leaves chopped separately
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
At the same time, add oil and onion to a medium saucepan and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until soft.
Add ginger, garlic, cilantro stalks and cumin and cook for another minute.
Add chickpeas, carrots, dates, tomato paste and stock. Season with salt and pepper, cover and simmer gently for 25 minutes.
Divide rice and chickpea braise between bowls and top with feta and cilantro leaves to serve.

name: Dahl with Sweet Potato & Zucchini
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (150g) dried red lentils well rinsed
1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
3 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cook for 15-20 minutes, remove from heat and rest for 5-10 minutes before fluffing with a fork to serve.
In a large saucepan, saute onion in the oil over medium heat for a few minutes to soften.
Add spices and continue to cook for another minute.
Add lentils and stock and bring to the boil. Add sweet potato and zucchini and cook over medium-high heat for 10 minutes or until the lentils are just soft.
Add tomatoes and coconut milk and simmer for 10 minutes or until thickened.
Stir through lime juice and zest and season with salt and pepper.
Divide dahl and rice between bowls and top with cilantro to serve.

name: Skillet Mushroom Quinoa Biriyani
ingredients: 3 tsp fresh ginger peeled and grated
1⁄4 tsp ground chilli or to taste
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 cup (180g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
1 sprig of fresh cilantro finely chopped
preparation: Add oil to a non-stick skillet over medium heat, add onion and saute for 3-5 minutes or until slightly golden.
Add ginger and garlic and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add mushrooms and allow to sweat down for 5 minutes.
At the same time combine coconut milk, spices, lemon and lime juice in a jar or bowl.
Add chickpeas and spinach to the skillet. Stir through coconut milk mixture and continue to cook for a few minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add quinoa spreading evenly across the skillet. Add stock, cover and bring to the boil.  Reduce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes or until quinoa is cooked.
Combine raita ingredients, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Divide between bowls and serve with raita and fresh cilantro.

name: Skillet Fish with Beans & Tomatoes
ingredients: 1 cup (180g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 lemon half juiced & half cut into wedges
preparation: Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Simmer, covered for 12-15 minutes or until cooked, rest covered for 5 minutes.

At the same time, heat half the oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Season fish with salt and pepper, add to skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate and cover to keep warm.
Cook onion in remaining oil for 2-3 minutes or until just softened. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Add tomatoes and capers and cook, stirring often, for 4-5 minutes or until tomatoes just begin to collapse.
Stir through quinoa, beans, spinach and lemon juice and cook until spinach has just wilted.
Season well and return fish to the skillet and warm through.
Divide between plates, scatter over almonds and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Braised Chicken with Vegetables
preparation: Season chicken with salt & pepper.
Heat a large pot over medium heat, add oil and swirl to coat the bottom. Add chicken and cook for 10 minutes, turning halfway through to brown. Remove chicken from pot and set aside.
Reduce heat, add leek and carrot to the pot and cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Return chicken to pot, add stock and potatoes and bring to a simmer. Cover with a lid and cook for 15 minutes or until chicken is tender.
Stir through peas and season to taste.
Divide between bowls and top with parsley to serve.

name: Moroccan Lentil Soup
ingredients: 2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes or until soft.
Add garlic and spices and cook for another minute.
Add stock, lentils and zucchini, cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until lentils are tender and soup has thickened.
Stir through spinach and season with salt and pepper.
Divide soup between bowls, top with yogurt and serve with toast.

name: Healthy Colorful Mac & Cheese
ingredients: 350g macaroni or small elbow pasta (or gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (45g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
3 cups (750ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Bring a pot of water to the boil, add a pinch of salt and cook pasta according to packet instructions. Add broccoli in last two minutes of cooking. Drain, reserving some of the water and set aside.
At the same time, heat a non-stick saucepan over medium-high heat. Add oil, onion and garlic and cook for 5-7 minutes to caramelize.
Add flour and mustard and cook, whisking for a minute.
Whisking constantly, gradually add milk and continue to whisk for 5 minutes or until the sauce is smooth and thickened. Adjust seasoning.

Add drained pasta and broccoli, spinach, two thirds of the cheese (reserving the rest for the topping) and all the parmesan and stir to combine. You may need to add a little pasta water if too thick. Adjust seasonings and transfer to a heat proof dish.
Preheat broiler.
In a small bowl, combine remaining cheese, almond meal and oregano and season with salt and pepper.
Scatter over pasta and place under broiler for 5 minutes or until golden.
Toss salad leaves with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Divide pasta between plates and serve with salad.

name: Skillet Beef & Mushroom Lasagna
ingredients: 1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked & torn, plus extra to serve
preparation: Heat an large non-stick skillet (with a lid) over medium-high heat. Cook onion, stirring, for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add beef, season with salt and pepper and cook, breaking up with a spoon, for 5 minutes until browned.
Add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes until softened.
Stir through diced tomatoes, tomato paste, water and basil. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
Spread sufficient sauce to cover the base of the skillet. Layer over half the lasagna sheets to cover the base. Add half of the sauce, remaining pasta and finish with remaining sauce.
Cover skillet with lid and return to low-medium heat. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 15 minutes or until pasta is cooked and sauce has thickened.
Sprinkle over mozzarella, cover and cook for a further 2 minutes to melt the cheese or place under a pre-heated broiler to brown.
Divide lasagna between plates and top with extra basil to serve.

name: Asian-Style Veggie 'Meatballs'
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped plus extra to serve
1 tbs all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) trimmed
2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper. Toast sesame seeds for a few minutes whilst oven is warming until golden and set aside.
Place rice, water and salt in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 25 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Meanwhile, heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add sesame oil and cook mushrooms for 4-5 minutes or until browned. Cool then transfer to a food processor.

Add chickpeas and walnuts and blend until almost smooth. Add cilantro, scallions, ginger, garlic and flour and pulse until combined. Roll mixture into 10 balls and place on baking sheet and cook for 25 minutes or until firm.

Meanwhile, heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add broccolini and 2 tablespoons of water and toss for 2 minutes until crisp-tender. Remove broccolini to a plate and add soy sauce, water and maple syrup to the skillet. Bring to a simmer and reduce by half until thick.
Divide rice, broccolini and ‘meatballs’ between bowls and drizzle with sauce. Scatter over sesame seeds and top with extra cilantro to serve.

name: Smoked Paprika Fish with Greens & Grains
ingredients: 450g white fish fillets 2 x 8oz fillets (Dan used Wild Alaskan Pollock)
120g green beans trimmed, cut in half
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place all rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Meanwhile, pat fish dry, rub with half the olive oil and season with paprika, salt and pepper. Place on tray and bake for 15-20 minutes or until fish is cooked through.
When fish is almost cooked, add remaining oil and garlic to a skillet and cook for about 30 seconds to a minute. Season with salt and pepper and sauté for another  minute.

Add beans, spinach and pepitas. Cook until pepitas are toasted and beans are tender and bright green, about 5-7 minutes. Add a splash of water if the pan is too dry. Remove from heat and adjust seasoning..
Divide rice, greens and fish between plates and add a squeeze of lemon to serve.

name: Split Pea & Bacon Soup
ingredients: 2 1⁄2 cups (500g) yellow split peas well rinsed
1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add bacon and cook for 4-5 minutes until crisp. Set aside half the bacon.
Add onion and celery to the saucepan with the bacon and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and cook for a minute until fragrant.
Add bay leaves, stock and split peas. Bring to a gentle simmer, cover and cook for 30 minutes or until peas are tender. (Add a little more stock or water if too thick)
Discard bay leaves and stir through parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Divide soup between bowls, top with reserved bacon and serve with warm rolls.

name: Grilled Chicken Tacos with Salsa
ingredients: 6 large (1 1/2 oz ea) corn tortillas warmed
preparation: To make salsa, combine ingredients in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Heat a non-stick BBQ or griddle pan over medium heat.
Rub chicken with spices and season with salt and pepper. Cook chicken for 8-10 minutes, turning once, until cooked through. Transfer to a board to rest for a few minutes, then slice.
To assemble tacos, scatter lettuce over tortillas, add avocado, chicken and spoon over salsa to serve.

name: Cajun Chicken Burger
ingredients: 4 (3 1/4 oz) large wholegrain/wholewheat rolls (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Preheat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
Split chicken breast horizontally through the middle to form thin fillets. Spray with oil and rub well with seasoning.
Cook chicken for 2-3 minutes, turn and cook for another 2 minutes, or until cooked through and golden. Season with salt and pepper.
Split warm rolls in half and spread the base with tzatziki. Add avocado, spinach, tomato and chicken and top with the other half of the roll to serve.

name: Turkey Burger with Hummus
preparation: Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and carrot and cook for 5-6 minutes until soft. Transfer to a bowl to cool slightly.
Add turkey, egg and cumin to the cooled vegetables. Season with salt and pepper and mix well to combine. Form into medium sized patties.
Wipe skillet down and return to medium heat. Cook patties for 8 minutes, turning  once, or until cooked through. Set patties aside to cool and then cook the remaining patties.
Spread hummus onto the base of the buns, then add turkey pattie, tomato, onion, lettuce and other half of the bun to serve.

name: Sheet-Pan Salmon & Broccoli with Ginger, Lime & Peanuts
ingredients: 1 head of broccoli (12 oz head) cut in small florets
2 1⁄2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & finely chopped, plus extra for garnish
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a shallow baking dish with baking paper.
Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Toss broccoli with garlic and scatter over baking dish.
Add salmon fillets, season with salt and pepper and cover the dish tightly with foil.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked to your liking.
Meanwhile, combine all dressing ingredients. Check the balance, adding extra fish sauce or lime juice if needed.
Divide salmon and broccoli between plates, drizzle over dressing, top with peanuts, extra cilantro and serve with rice.

name: Beef Burger with Salad
ingredients: 2 tbs (20g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
4 medium (2 1/2oz) wholegrain/wholewheat (or gluten free)rolls cut in half horizontally
1 tbs sriracha sauce (chilli garlic sauce) optional
preparation: Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes until caramelised and tender. Transfer to a plate.

Meanwhile, combine beef, oats and herbs. Form into patties and season with salt and pepper. Cook one side for 3-4 minutes. Flip and top with cheese. Cook for a further 3 minutes until patties are cooked and cheese has melted. Remove from heat.
To assemble burgers, place lettuce and tomato on the base of each bun. Top with patties, onions, sriracha and other half of the bun to serve.

name: Chicken & Ginger Stir-Fry
ingredients: 400g skinless chicken breast cut into strips
2 scallions thinly sliced plus extra to serve
1 tbs (20ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a small saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Combine sauce ingredients in a small bowl and whisk to combine.
Meanwhile heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add almonds and sesame seeds and toast for 3-4 minutes, stirring, until golden. Remove and set aside to cool.

Toss chicken pieces with half the oil. Add to hot wok and allow to cook for at least a minute without stirring to begin browning the chicken. Continue to cook, stir-frying for another 3-4 minutes until chicken is golden. Remove from wok and set aside in a warm place.
Add remaining oil, ginger and broccoli to hot wok and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add snowpeas and scallions and cook for a few more minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Stir through sauce and chicken and cook for a minute to heat through.
Divide rice and stir-fry between bowls and scatter over extra scallions, almonds and sesame seeds to serve.

name: Beef & Vegetable Enchiladas
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) stems finely chopped & leaves roughly chopped separately
1 1⁄2 tsp Mexican spice mix (a mix of ground cumin, paprika & chilli pepper)
4 square (1 oz ea) mountain bread wraps (or gluten free)
preparation: Preheat an oven broiler to medium-high and line a small baking dish with baking paper.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add oil, onion, bell pepper and cilantro stems and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes until soft.
Add zucchini and beef and cook for another 5 minutes until browned.
Add spice and half the tomato puree and simmer for 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper.
Cut each wrap in half, lengthways, down the centre. Divide beef mixture down the center of each piece. Roll and place seam-side down onto the baking dish.
Pour remaining tomato puree over enchiladas and scatter over cheese. Place under preheated broiler for 2 minutes, until cheese melts.
Divide enchiladas between plates and serve topped with cilantro leaves.

name: Veggie Frittata
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
