preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper.
Add sweet potatoes to a saucepan of cold salted water and bring to a boil. Simmer for 8-10 minutes until tender. Drain and set aside.
At the same time place spinach in a bowl, cover with boiling water and set aside for a few minutes. Drain and once cool roughly chop.
Arrange cooked sweet potato, spinach, half the tomatoes and half the feta in prepared tin.
Whisk together eggs, milk and parmesan and season with salt and pepper.
Pour mixture over vegetables and scatter over remaining tomatoes and feta. Add spoonfuls of pesto and bake for 40-45 minutes until golden and egg is set.
Divide between plates and serve warm or cold.
Can be stored refrigerated in an airtight container for 3 days.

name: Chicken, Leek & Butter Bean Soup
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves stripped, plus extra to serve
2 sprigs of fresh rosemary leaves stripped & chopped
2 cans of butter beans (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
120g flat rice noodles cooked according to packet but, undercook by about 1 minute
preparation: Heat a large stock pot over medium-low heat. Add oil, leek, onion and garlic, season well with salt and pepper and sauté for 5 minutes until veggies are soft and tender.
Add thyme, rosemary and bay leaf and sauté for another minute.
Add stock, bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook on low heat for 10 minutes.
Add chicken and continue to simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until chicken is cooked. Remove from soup and shred with two forks.
Return shredded chicken to pot, add beans and warm through.
Stir through cooked noodles.
Divide between bowls and serve top with extra thyme to serve.

name: Turmeric Tofu & Coconut Curry with Chickpeas
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) stems finely chopped & leaves torn apart
2 cans of chickpeas (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Heat a large stock pot over medium-low heat.
Add oil, onion, garlic and ginger and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 5-8 minutes.
Add cilantro stems, turmeric, garam masala, cumin, salt and pepper, stirring well to incorporate and cook for a minute. Add tofu and saute for a few minutes.
Add coconut milk and stock and simmer gently, uncovered for 10 minutes, or until sauce has reduced.
Stir through chickpeas and continue to cook for 5 minutes. Adjust seasoning.
Divide curry and rice between bowls and top with cilantro leaves to serve.

name: Loaded Sweet Potato Jackets
ingredients: 3 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves stripped
1⁄2 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line two baking sheets with baking paper.
Spike sweet potatoes all over with a fork and transfer to a sheet. Spray with oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 40-50 minutes or until super soft.
At the same time, place tomatoes on a sheet and top with thyme and rosemary and season with salt and pepper.  Add garlic to the tray and roast for 20-25 minutes or until tomatoes are soft and jammy.
Blend roasted tomato and garlic in a blender until smooth.
Heat oil in a non stick skillet on medium-high heat and caramelise onion for 4-6 minutes.
Add turkey and brown for 4-5 minutes.
Stir through tomato sauce and chopped basil, simmer for a few minutes and adjust seasoning.
Cut sweet potatoes in half and divide between plates. Top with sauce and extra basil leaves and serve with tzatziki.

name: Sweet Potato Cottage Pie
preparation: Place sweet potato in a saucepan of cold salted water and simmer for 10 minutes, or until tender. Drain and mash.
At the same time, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion for 5 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Increase heat to high. Add beef, season with salt and pepper and cook for a few minutes without stirring. Stir and continue to cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally until browned.
Add tomato paste and cook for a few more minutes.

Combine cornstarch with a small amount of stock and stir until smooth. Add to pan along with remaining stock, zucchini and carrot. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 7-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until liquid reduces to a thick sauce. Adjust seasoning.
Preheat a broiler to high.
Transfer meat to an 8 inch round pie dish and cover with mash.
Place under the broiler for 5-10 minutes or until top is golden.
Divide between plates and serve with salad leaves tossed with vinegar and seasoned with salt and pepper.

name: Greek Chicken & Lemon Soup (Avgolemono)
preparation: Heat a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and sauté for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add chicken and stock and bring to the boil. Reduce to a low simmer, cover, and cook for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook risoni in a saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions. Drain.
Remove chicken from soup, shred meat and set aside.
Crack eggs into a bowl and whisk until frothy. Add lemon juice and whisk to combine.

Slowly ladle 1 cup of soup stock into eggs while continuously whisking so eggs won’t scramble. Remove soup from heat and slowly pour in the egg mixture, while whisking soup continuously, until soup is creamy.
Return chicken to soup, add risoni, stir to combine and adjust seasoning.
Divide soup between serving bowls, scatter over parsley and serve with warm baguette.

name: Jerk Chicken with Tomato & Bean Salsa
ingredients: 1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.
Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Toss chicken with spices, pepper and salt.
Heat oil in a large oven-proof skillet over medium heat.

Add chicken and cook for 3-5 minutes or until slightly golden. Flip chicken over and place skillet in the oven for a further 7-9 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Set aside in a warm place and rest for a few minutes.
Combine salsa ingredients and season with salt and pepper.
Thinly slice chicken and divide between plates. Add salsa and rice to serve.

name: Seared Salmon with BBQ Veg & Mint Yogurt
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & finely chopped
preparation: Place potatoes in a saucepan of cold, salted water and simmer for 8-10 minutes or until tender.
Heat BBQ to medium high heat.
Toss eggplant slices with half the oil and cook for 4-5 minutes, turn and cook for another 3-4 minutes until soft. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Add bell peppers, asparagus and tomatoes to BBQ, season with salt and pepper and cook for 5-7 minutes. Set aside (by this stage you should have some nice char).

Rub remaining oil over salmon and sear, skin side down, for 4-5 minutes or until crispy. Flip salmon and add vegetables back to the BBQ. Close the lid and cook for another 4-5 minutes or until salmon is cooked to your liking.
At the same time combine mint yogurt ingredients, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Divide salmon, potatoes and vegetables between plates and serve with mint yogurt.

name: Roast Lamb with Mint Garlic Sauce
ingredients: 3 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves picked
3 sprigs of fresh rosemary leaves picked & chopped
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked and chopped
3 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Mix together oil and thyme leaves and season with salt and pepper. Set aside half for the potatoes and add rosemary and garlic to the remainder. Massage into the lamb and set aside to marinate. (Depending on time available, 20 minutes, several hours, overnight or up to 24 hours)
Preheat oven to 355°F.
Line a baking sheet with baking paper. Toss potatoes with remaining oil and thyme and scatter over baking sheet.
Place lamb on a wire rack set over a baking dish, to collect any juices. Season lamb again and roast for 30 minutes. Baste with any remaining marinade or juices whilst the lamb cooks.
Add sheet of potatoes to the oven with the lamb and continue to cook for another 35 minutes or until lamb is cooked and potatoes are golden and crispy.
At the same time, combine sauce ingredients and season with salt and pepper.
Remove lamb from the oven, cover loosely with foil and set aside to rest for 10-20 minutes.
Toss salad leaves, scallion, mint and lemon juice together and season with salt and pepper.
Slice lamb and serve with roast potatoes, salad and mint garlic sauce.

name: Skillet Chicken & Greens with Avocado Dressing
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) roughly chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Preheat a large non-stick skillet over high heat.
Toss beans with half the oil, add to skillet and cook for 2 minutes or until just beginning to brown. Set aside.
Rub chicken with remaining oil and season with salt and pepper. Add to skillet topside down, and cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown.
Turn chicken and add stock to the skillet . Cover and simmer over low heat for 8-10 minutes or until chicken is almost cooked.
Return beans to the skillet with chicken, cover and continue to simmer for 2 minutes.
At the same time, blend dressing ingredients until smooth and season with salt and pepper.
Slice chicken, divide between plates and drizzle over any pan juices.
Add rice and beans to plates and serve with dressing.

name: 4 Ingredient Zucchini & Halloumi Patties
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 tbs all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
2 small red chilli peppers thinly sliced
6 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked & sliced
2 large (3 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita breads or pockets (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Squeeze as much water out of the zucchini as you can and transfer to a medium bowl.
Add halloumi, sweet potato and flour, season with salt and pepper and mix to combine.
Form mixture into 12 patties, continuing to squeeze out as much liquid as you can, (mixture will be quite loose but will firm up in the pan as the halloumi melts).

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-low heat and cook patties for 5 minutes each side, pressing down with a spatula, until golden on both sides. Transfer to a plate to cool slightly and firm up.
Top patties with chilli and mint and serve with lettuce and warm pita bread.

name: Sheet-Pan Spanish Chicken
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F.
Rub chicken with a small amount of oil and toss with paprika, salt and pepper.
Arrange potatoes and capsicum in an 8 inch square baking dish. Whisk remaining oil and stock together, pour over vegetables and bake for 15 minutes.
Place chicken on top of vegetables and scatter over oregano. Return to oven and bake for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Scatter over olives to serve.

name: Warm Roasted Eggplant Salad with Hazelnuts
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
4 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
2 medium (2 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita pockets (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Preheat oven to  355°F and line a shallow baking dish with baking paper.
Place eggplant in dish, brush with a little water and scatter over dukkah, pressing well into the flesh.
Pat chickpeas dry with paper towel, add to dish with the eggplant and spray with oil. Roast for 30 minutes until golden.
At the same time, toast hazelnuts for a few minutes.
Meanwhile, mix both cheeses, lemon zest and season with salt and pepper.
Spread cheese over a serving platter, add eggplant and scatter over chickpeas.
Drizzle over lemon juice and top with mint and chopped hazelnuts. Season with salt and pepper and serve with warm pita bread.

name: Satay Soba Noodles with Chicken & Cabbage
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch)
1 1⁄2 tbs (30ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 1⁄2 tbs (30g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Rub chicken with a little oil, season with salt and pepper and place on sheet. Toss cabbage with the remaining oil, season with salt and pepper and add to sheet. Roast for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Rest for 5 minutes then shred chicken with two forks.
At the same time, whisk sauce ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.

Cook noodles according to packet directions, until almost cooked. Undercook them by about 1-2 minutes as they’ll finish cooking in the sauce. Rinse well in cold water, this prevents them from becoming gluggy.
Add sauce and noodles to a frypan and cook over low heat until sauce is beginning to coat the noodles. Stir through chicken and cabbage.
Divide between bowls and top with peanuts and cilantro to serve.

name: Simple Pea & Pancetta Pasta
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (60g) parmesan finely grated plus extra to serve
preparation: Cook pasta in a large non-stick saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions. Add peas to saucepan in the last few minutes of cooking. Reserve 1⁄3 cup of pasta water, drain off remainder and set pasta and peas aside in a warm place.
Add pancetta to the hot saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring, for 4-5 minutes until beginning to crisp. Add pine nuts in the last few minutes of cooking to toast.
Add reserved pasta water and parmesan to the saucepan of pancetta and pine nuts, scaping any browned pieces from the bottom, and stir until creamy.
Add pasta and spinach and toss together until spinach has wilted. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide between bowls and top with extra parmesan to serve.

name: Satay Soba Noodles With Crispy Chickpeas
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 head of broccoli (12 oz head) cut into florets
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
1 1⁄2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 1⁄2 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Scatter broccoli and chickpeas over sheet, spray with oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes or until chickpeas and broccoli are beginning to crisp and turn golden brown.
At the same time, whisk sauce ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.

Cook noodles according to packet directions, until almost cooked. Undercook them by about 1-2 minutes as they’ll finish cooking in the sauce. Rinse well in cold water, this prevents them from becoming gluggy.
Add sauce and noodles to a skillet and cook over low heat until sauce is beginning to coat the noodles. Stir through broccoli and chickpeas.
Divide between bowls and top with peanuts and cilantro to serve.

name: Honey Pork with Bok Choy
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 scallions thinly sliced, plus extra to serve
1 bunch of baby bok choy (buk, pak or puk choy)(5 oz bunch) halved lengthways
1⁄4 cup (60ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Meanwhile, to make the sauce, mix corn starch and soy together in a small bowl until smooth. Add Shaoxing, honey and water and mix to combine. Set aside.
Heat sesame seeds in a dry wok or non-stick skillet over medium heat and toss for 1 minute until golden brown. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool.
Add half the oil, scallions, ginger and bok choy to the hot wok and stir fry for 4-5 minutes until bok choy is crisp-tender. Transfer to a plate.
Add remaining oil and pork to wok and stir fry for 3-4 minutes until just cooked. Add sauce and bok choy to the pork and toss for a minute to warm through and thicken sauce.
Divide rice and pork between bowls and top with extra scallions and sesame seeds to serve.

name: Potato & Bell Pepper Tortilla with Tomato Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 400g potatoes peeled & thinly sliced on a mandolin
1 red bell pepper deseeded & cut into strips
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.
Heat oil in a medium oven-proof skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic, potatoes and bell pepper and cook, stirring, for a further 8-10 minutes until potatoes are tender. Reduce heat to low.

Season eggs with salt and pepper and pour evenly over vegetables. Cook for 5 minutes until bottom is set. Transfer to the oven and cook for a further 10 minutes until the egg is completely set and cooked.
Meanwhile, gently toss salad ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.
Turn warm tortilla out onto a board, cut into quarters and serve with salad.

name: Beef Sukiyaki
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
75g snow peas very thinly sliced lengthways
preparation: Cook noodles according to packet instructions. Drain, toss with half the oil and set aside.
Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a large non-stick skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add beef and cook for a few minutes to brown. Cover loosely and set aside.
Reduce heat to medium and cook onion for 8-10 minutes until softened and caramelized.
Add stock and bring to the boil, scraping any caramelized onion from the bottom of the pan.
Add mirin, soy and mushrooms and simmer for 2-3 minutes until mushrooms are tender.
Divide noodles between serving bowls. Add mushroom broth and top with beef and snow peas and scatter over sesame seeds to serve.

name: Dukkah Lamb Backstrap with Tomato & Feta Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & shredded
preparation: Preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.

Place dukkah on a plate and roll lamb into spice, pressing down firmly. Transfer to skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes each side for medium, or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate, cover loosely with foil and allow to rest for 5 minutes before thinly slicing.
Meanwhile, add salad ingredients to a large bowl, season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
Divide salad between serving plates, top with lamb slices and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Shrimp Salad with Rice Noodles & Honey Dressing
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & roughly torn
1 1⁄2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Cook rice vermicelli according to packet instructions. Drain and set aside.
Whisk dressing ingredients together in a large bowl until combined and toss with drained noodles.
Add cabbages, carrot, scallions and mint and toss well. Adjust seasoning.
Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp and cook for 1-2 minutes each side until just cooked and toss through salad.
Divide between serving plates and scatter over sesame seeds to serve.

name: Broccoli Soup with Ricotta Toast
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 500g broccoli cut into florets & stems diced
2 sprigs of parsley leaves stripped & chopped
4 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat oil in a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and celery and sauté for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Add stock and bring to the boil. Add broccoli and simmer for 4-5 minutes until tender.
Remove from heat and add cottage cheese. Blend with a stick blender until smooth and adjust seasoning.
Divide soup between bowls and top with parsley.
Spread toast with ricotta, season with salt and pepper and serve with soup.

name: BBQ Lamb & Mixed Pepper Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 1⁄4 cups (225g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1 lemon half juiced & half cut into wedges
preparation: Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered for 12 minutes or until just cooked. Rest covered for 5 minutes then fluff with a fork.

Meanwhile, preheat a BBQ or non-stick griddle pan over medium-high heat. Season lamb with salt and pepper and cook for 3-4 minutes each side for medium, or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate, cover loosely and rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing.
Add bell peppers to BBQ and cook for 5-8 minutes, tossing occasionally, until tender.
Toss quinoa with spinach and lemon juice and adjust seasoning.
Divide quinoa and bell pepper slices between plates and top with lamb, feta and lemon wedge to serve.

name: Korean Beef Bulgogi Bowl
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 tbs (20ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
At the same time, place onion, garlic, ginger, soy, honey and half the sesame oil in a bowl and whisk to combine. Add beef and toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 25 minutes.
In last 5 minutes of rice cooking, heat a wok or large non-stick skillet over high heat. Drain beef from marinade, reserving the marinade.
Add remaining sesame oil to the hot wok and stir-fry half the beef for 1-2 minutes or until just cooked, set aside. Cook remaining beef and set aside with other cooked beef.
Toss broccoli in remaining marinade, adding a little water if needed, and stir-fry for a few minutes until crisp-tender, adding edamame for last minute to heat through.
Divide rice between bowls and top with beef, vegetables and kimchi. Scatter over scallions and peanuts to serve.

name: Ham, Arugula & Olive Pizza
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 large (3 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita breads or pockets (or gluten free)
4 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven and pizza tray to 430°F.
Spread tomato paste evenly over pita breads and top with mozzarella, onion, ham and olives.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden.
Top with basil leaves and arugula and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Vegan Burger Bowl with Fries
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 400g sweet potatoes peeled & cut into fries
3 tsp olive oil olive oil spray
4 field mushrooms wiped clean & stem trimmed
1 head of baby romaine lettuce shredded
1 can of kidney beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line 2 medium baking sheets with baking paper.
Toss potatoes with oil, cumin and salt and pepper and arrange on one baking sheet.
Place mushrooms on the other sheet and season with salt and pepper. (Dont be tempted to add to the tray of potatoes as they may seep water and make your fries soggy!)
Place both sheets in the oven and bake for 15 minutes, or until potatoes are golden and tender. Scatter cheese over mushrooms and return to the oven for 2 minutes to melt cheese.
Meanwhile, combine beets and vinegar in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper and toss to coat.
Divide lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, beans, lentils, pickled beets and mushrooms between bowls. Squeeze over lemon, season and serve with sweet potato fries.

name: Bean Enchiladas with Salsa
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 tsp Mexican spice mix (a mix of ground cumin, paprika & chilli pepper)
2 can of black beans (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
4 square (1 oz ea) mountain bread wraps (or gluten free)
preparation: Preheat an oven broiler to medium-high and spray a small baking dish with oil.
Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Set aside 1 tablespoon of onion, then add the remaining to the skillet with the bell pepper. Cook, stirring, for 10 minutes until soft.
At the same time combine salsa ingredients with the reserved onion. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Add garlic to cooked onion and cook for a minute until fragrant.
Add spice, puree and black beans and season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens. Remove from heat and adjust seasoning.
Cut wraps in half and add bean mixture down the center of each. Roll and place seam-side down in baking dish. Scatter over cheese and place under broiler for 2 minutes, until cheese melts.
Divide enchiladas between plates and serve topped with salsa.

name: Baked Salmon with Sweet Potato Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss sweet potato with oil and arrange on sheet. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 15 minutes.
At the same time, roast pine nuts for 3-4 minutes until golden and set aside.
Rub oregano over salmon and add to the sheet of sweet potato. Add tomatoes and return the sheet to oven for a further 10 minutes or until potato is tender and salmon is just cooked.
Divide spinach between plates and top with sweet potato, tomatoes and pine nuts. Add salmon, season and squeeze over lemon to serve.

name: Turkey with Green Bean Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 400g turkey breast sliced in half horizontally
preparation: Cook pasta according to packet instructions. Drain and set aside.

Meanwhile, heat butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Season turkey with salt and pepper and cook for 3-4 minutes each side, until caramelised and cooked through. Transfer turkey to a plate, cover loosely with foil and set aside to rest.
In the same hot skillet, add beans and stock, cover and cook for 3 minutes until crisp tender.
Toss tomatoes, almonds and risoni through beans and season with salt and pepper.
Divide salad and turkey between plates to serve.

name: Grilled Fish, Broccolini & Noodles
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 tbs sesame seeds plus extra to serve
1 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) trimmed & halved
1 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and toast sesame seeds until golden and set aside.

Keep skillet over medium heat. Toss fish with oil, season with salt and pepper and add to the hot skillet. Cook for 3 minutes each side or until cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside in a warm place.
Meanwhile, cook the noodles according to packet instructions and add broccolini to the pot for the last 2 minutes.

Using tongs, remove noodles and broccolini from water and add to the hot skillet. Add sesame oil, soy sauce and toasted sesame seeds, toss well and cook for a minute to heat through. (You may need to add a little cooking water).
Divide noodles and broccolini between plates, add fish and scatter over extra sesame seeds to serve.

name: One-Pot Chicken Meatballs with Risoni
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 zucchini (medium) finely grated & excess water squeezed out
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked & finely chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: Combine mince, parmesan, zucchini, garlic and basil in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper and mix well to combine. With wet hands divide mixture into even tablespoon-sized portions and roll meatballs (mixture will be soft but manageable).
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook meatballs for 3-5 minutes, turning until browned all over.
Add tomato puree, stock and risoni to pan with meatballs and stir to combine. Bring to a simmer and cook uncovered for 10 minutes, or until pasta and meatballs are cooked and sauce has thickened.
Meanwhile toss salad leaves with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Divide meatballs and sauce between bowls, top with extra basil and serve with salad.

name: Easy Beef Stir-Fry
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 450g beef sirloin steak cut in strips
2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
400g fresh egg noodles (or gluten free) cooked according to packet instructions & drained
preparation: Heat wok over high heat and toast cashews for a few minutes until golden. Set aside and roughly chop once cool.
Reduce heat to low, add oil, garlic and ginger to wok and cook stirring constantly for 2 minutes until golden.
Increase heat to high, add beef and cook for 2 minutes. Add beans and continue to cook for another two minutes.
Add sauces and toss well. Adjust seasoning, stir through drained noodles and cook for another minute to warm through.
Divide between plates, scatter over toasted cashews and chilli to serve.

name: Carrot, Ginger & Coconut Soup
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
preparation: Wrap tofu in paper towel and press under a weight (cans of beans on a chopping board) to remove water. Dice tofu into cubes and set aside.
Heat a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat and saute onion for 5 minutes until soft. Add ginger and turmeric and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add carrots and stock, bring to a low simmer and cook covered for 10 minutes, or until carrots are soft.
At the same time, heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and cook tofu for 5-6 minutes until golden all over. Set aside and keep warm.
Remove soup from heat, add coconut cream and blend with a stick blender until smooth. Adjust seasoning.
Ladle soup into bowls, top with tofu and sesame seeds and serve with warm baguette.

name: Eggplant Dahl
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) stalks finely chopped & leaves separated
preparation: Heat a non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add oil and onion and sauté for 5 minutes until soft. Add ginger, garlic and cilantro stalks and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add garam masala, turmeric and eggplant and mix to coat.
Add peas and stock and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 30 minutes or until peas are tender. (You may need to add a little more water if too thick.) Season with salt and pepper.
Divide dahl between bowls, drizzle over coconut cream and scatter cilantro leaves to serve.

name: Loaded Chipotle Chicken Fries
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 tsp Mexican spice mix (a mix of ground cumin, paprika & chilli pepper)
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place potatoes on sheet, spray with oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 20-25 minutes until golden and crisp.
Meanwhile, heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook onion for 5 minutes or until soft.
Add chicken and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally for a further 3-4 minutes or until chicken is cooked.
Add bell pepper and continue to cook for a few more minutes. Add Mexican spice, paprika, spinach and water and cook, stirring, for a further 1-2 minutes until spinach has wilted.
Place fries in an ovenproof serving dish, top with chicken and cheese and return to the oven for a few minutes until cheese has melted.
Top with cilantro to serve.

name: Zucchini & Hazelnut Flat Breads
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 medium (2 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita pockets (or gluten free)
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked
preparation: Place two unlined baking sheets in the oven and preheat to 355°F.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook onion for a few minutes until beginning to soften. Add zucchini and garlic and cook for a few more minutes until zucchini is lightly browned. Season with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, mix together cottage cheese and parmesan and season. Spread pitas with cheese mixture and arrange zucchini and onion mixture on top.
Place pita breads on preheated sheets and bake for 10 minutes or until crisp.
Scatter over mint, chilli and hazelnuts. Cut into wedges and serve.

name: Beef Pad Thai
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 tsp coconut sugar or brown sugar
preparation: Soak noodles in water for 10 minutes, then drain.
Combine both sauces, tamarind and sugar in a bowl and set sauce aside.

Heat half the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until hot. Add shrimp and egg, tipping to cover base with mixture and cook for about 2 minutes until egg has just set. Remove from wok, roll up,  thinly slice and set aside.
Without washing the wok, add remaining oil and heat until hot. Add beef and cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally to evenly brown all over.
Stir through noodles and sauce and continue to toss until noodles are evenly coated and sauce has thickened.
Stir through sliced egg, bean shoots, peanuts and chives.
Serve immediately with lime wedges.

name: Tofu Pad Thai
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 tbs kecap manis (sweet soy sauce) (or gluten-free equivalent)
1 1⁄2 tbs light soy sauce (or gluten-free equivalent)
400g firm tofu cut in 1 x 2 inch batons
preparation: Soak noodles in water for 10 minutes, then drain.
Combine sauces and tamarind in a bowl and set sauce aside.

Heat half the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until hot. Add egg, tipping to cover base and cook for about 2 minutes until egg has just set. Remove from wok, roll up, thinly slice and set aside.
Without washing the wok, add remaining oil and heat until hot. Add tofu and cook for a few minutes, stirring occasionally to evenly brown all over.
Stir through noodles and sauce and continue to toss until noodles are evenly coated and sauce has thickened.
Stir through sliced egg, bean shoots, peanuts and chives.
Serve immediately with lime wedges.

name: Vegetable Red Curry with Quinoa
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 400g sweet potatoes cut into 1/2 inch cubes
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & roughly chopped
1⁄2 small red chilli pepper thinly sliced
preparation: Place the tofu on a plate lined with paper towel. Cover the tofu with more paper towel and press down gently to absorb as much liquid as you can. Cut into cubes and set aside.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Toss sweet potato with oil and cook for 5 minutes, turning, until beginning to brown. Set sweet potato aside, leaving skillet over heat.
Add tofu to the skillet and cook, turning until golden. Set aside.

Return skillet to heat, add curry paste and cook for a few minutes. Add coconut milk, stock and bell pepper and simmer for 10 minutes until slightly reduced. Add broccoli and continue to simmer for 5 minutes. Gently stir sweet potato and tofu through and return to a simmer for 3 minutes. Adjust seasoning.
Heat quinoa according to packet instructions and divide between bowls. Add curry and top with cilantro and chilli to serve.

name: Vegan Laksa
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of baby bok choy (buk, pak or puk choy)(5 oz bunch) cut into quarters lengthways
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
preparation: Cook rice noodles according to packet instructions. Drain and set aside.

Meanwhile, heat a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add laksa paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Add tofu and cook, stirring occasionally, for 2-3 minutes until well coated and just beginning to crisp.
Add stock and coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add broccoli and cook for 3 minutes until broccoli is crisp tender.
Add bok choy and cook for 1-2 minutes until just wilted.
To serve, divide noodles and laksa between bowls, squeeze over lime and top with cilantro and chilli.

name: Sheet-Pan Yellow Curry Chicken & Veggies
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
2 large (4 oz ea) naan breads (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Mix curry paste and coconut milk together (you may need to add a little water if too thick). Add chicken, cauliflower and squash and toss to coat.
Arrange chicken and vegetables on prepared sheet and roast for 40-45 minutes until chicken is golden and crisp and vegetables are tender.
Divide between plates, top with cilantro and serve with lime wedges and warm naan bread.

name: Masala Fish Curry
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 35 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.

Meanwhile, heat oil in a non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and sauté for 5 minutes until soft. Add ginger, garam masala and turmeric and cook for another minute until fragrant. Add tomatoes, squash and water. Bring to a low simmer and cook, covered, for 15 minutes.
Add fish to curry, cover and simmer for 6-7 minutes until fish is just cooked and squash is tender. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide rice and curry between bowls, top with cilantro and serve with yogurt.

name: Whole Roasted Cauliflower
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 cup (180g) red quinoa (or other color) rinsed
2 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
1 head of cauliflower (2 lb head) leaves trimmed
2 cans of chickpeas (14 oz cans) drained, rinsed & 10 chickpeas set aside for dressing
1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped, plus extra to serve
1⁄4 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes or until cooked, rest covered for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Meanwhile, combine spice and oil in a small bowl. Place cauliflower on sheet and rub spice paste over to cover and bake for 25 minutes.
Scatter chickpeas (except reserved 10) around cauliflower and continue to bake for a further 25-30 minutes, or until cauliflower is tender and chickpeas are crisp.
Combine reserved chickpeas with dressing ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth, thinning with a little water if dressing is too thick.
Toss quinoa, parsley and onion in a medium bowl, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Scatter reserved parsley over cauliflower and chickpeas, season and serve with quinoa and tahini dressing.

name: Shrimp Pad Thai
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked and stems finely chopped separately
1⁄2 red bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Cook noodles according to packet instructions. Drain, refresh under cold water and drain again.

Heat half the oil in a wok or large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add eggs, swirling the wok around to spread evenly and cook until set. Transfer to a board, roll up and slice into thin strips. Set aside.
Add remaining oil to wok. Add cilantro stems and bell peppers and cook for 3-4 minutes until just crisp tender. Add shrimp and continue to stir-fry for 2 minutes, or until just cooked.
Add noodles, egg, snow peas, scallions, fish sauce and honey and toss for 1-2 minutes until heated through. Adjust seasoning.
Divide noodles between bowls and top with bean shoots, cilantro leaves, peanuts, chilli (if using) and drizzle over lime juice to serve.

name: Roast Turkey Roll with Easy Cranberry Sauce
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
ingredients: 1 sprig of fresh thyme leaves stripped
1 bunch of English spinach (14 oz bunch) trimmed & well washed
3 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place turkey thigh on a chopping board, skin-side-down. Season with salt and pepper and rub in the garlic, lemon zest and thyme. Roll up and tie with kitchen twine to secure into a roll.
Rub oil over turkey, season with salt and pepper and roast on prepared sheet for 15 minutes.

Reduce oven temperature to  355°F and add potatoes to the sheet. Roast for a further 30 minutes, until turkey is cooked. Remove turkey from sheet, cover loosely with foil and set aside to rest for 15 minutes. Continue to cook potatoes for another 10-15 minutes until golden and cooked.

Meanwhile, for the cranberry sauce, combine cornstarch with apple juice in a small saucepan. Add cranberries and simmer for 5 minutes until cranberries begin to burst and sauce has thickened. Stir through maple syrup and set aside to cool.
Heat butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Once foaming, add spinach and toss for 1-2 minutes until wilted.
Slice turkey, divide between plates and serve with potatoes, spinach and cranberry sauce.

name: Sesame Chicken Stir-Fry with Broccolini
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) chopped into pieces
2 carrots (medium) finely sliced on the diagonal
3 tbs (60ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
2 cups (320g) microwave brown rice prepare to packet instructions
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked, to serve
2 tbs (30g) sesame seeds toasted, to serve
preparation: Heat a large non-stick skillet over high heat and add sesame oil. Add chicken, stirring constantly for 4-5 minutes.

Add garlic, ginger and onion and stir for another minute. Add broccolini, carrots, soy sauce and lime juice.  Stir-fry for 3 minutes, or until the vegetables are golden but still with a bit of crunch. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Divide rice between plates, add stir-fry and top with the lime zest, bean shoots, cilantro, sesame seeds and extra pepper to taste.

name: Pasta e Fagioli with Kale
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 150g macaroni or small elbow pasta (or gluten free) or ditalini if available
2 cans of cannellini beans (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves stripped & torn
4 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Cook pasta in salted boiling water according to packet instructions. Drain.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add tomato puree and water, bring to the boil and reduce to a low simmer for 10 minutes until sauce has reduced slightly.
Add cannellini beans, kale and basil and stir for 1 minute until heated and wilted. Stir through pasta and season with salt and pepper.
Divide pasta e fagioli between serving plates, sprinkle with parmesan and an extra grinding of black pepper to serve.

name: Beef, Lime & Cilantro Fajita Bowl
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 cayenne chilli pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
preparation: Rub beef with half the oil and season with salt and pepper. Heat a barbecue or large skillet over medium-high heat and cook beef for 2-3 minutes each side, or until cooked to your liking. Remove and rest for 5 minutes before thinly slicing into strips.
In the same skillet, add remaining oil, bell pepper and onion and cook for 5 minutes, stirring, until the vegetables are slightly charred and just tender. Remove from skillet and set aside.
Add beans and quinoa to skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, until heated through.
Divide lettuce between serving bowls and add vegetables, bean mix, sliced beef and avocado. Top with chilli pepper and cilantro and serve with lime wedges.

name: Chicken Soup with Pesto
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 200g green beans trimmed & cut into 3/4 inch lengths
140g macaroni or small elbow pasta (or gluten free)
preparation: Heat a large non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and celery and cook for 5 minutes until soft. Add garlic and chicken and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add zucchini, tomato puree and chicken stock. Bring to a boil, reduce to a gentle simmer, cover and cook for 15 minutes.
Add beans and macaroni and cook for a further 10 minutes until pasta is cooked (you may need to add a little more liquid), season with salt and pepper.
To serve, divide soup between bowls, add pesto, scatter over parmesan cheese and season to taste.

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice with Bacon
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 head of cauliflower (2 lb head) cut into large pieces
1⁄2 red bell pepper deseeded & finely sliced
2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Pulse cauliflower in a food processor until it resembles rice. Transfer to a clean kitchen towel and press to remove excess moisture and set aside.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook bacon. Remove bacon from pan and thinly slice.
In the same skillet over medium heat, add oil and eggs, tipping to cover base with egg mixture. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until just set. Remove from skillet, roll up and thinly slice.
Add carrot and bell pepper to skillet and cook for a few minutes.
Add ginger and cauliflower to skillet and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add bacon, rice, peas and soy sauce and continue to cook for 5 minutes. Adjust seasoning.
Divide ‘rice’ between bowls and top with egg, scallions, peanuts and chilli and squeeze over lemon juice to serve.

name: Tofu Bibimbap
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 35 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Meanwhile, wrap tofu in a few layers of paper towel and press down gently to absorb as much liquid as possible.
Heat a skillet over medium heat. Slice tofu and cook, for 3-4 minutes each side or until golden. Set aside and keep warm.
Add carrot to skillet and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes until tender. Set aside and keep warm.
Add spinach to skillet and cook for 1 minute until wilted. Set aside.
Add bean shoots to skillet and cook for 1 minute until just beginning to wilt.
To assemble, divide rice between serving bowls. Add tofu and vegetables and season with salt and pepper.
Whisk mirin and sesame oil in a small bowl and drizzle over tofu and vegetables. Top with scallions and sesame seeds to serve.

name: Lemon Dill Fish with Greek Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 lemon half zested & juiced, half cut in wedges
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place potato in a saucepan of cold, salted water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 8-10 minutes or until cooked. Drain, refresh in cold water and spread on a plate to cool.

In a large bowl mix together dill, lemon zest, oil and season with salt and pepper. Add fish and toss to coat. Transfer fish to baking sheet and pour over any remaining marinade. Bake for 10-12 minutes until fish is just cooked.
Meanwhile, place cucumber, tomato, onion, olives, oil and lemon juice in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and toss with potatoes to combine.
Divide salad between plates, crumble over feta and serve with fish and lemon wedges.

name: Spicy Tofu Stir-Fry
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 3 scallions thinly sliced, plus extra to serve
3 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
200g green beans trimmed & cut in half
preparation: Place noodles in a bowl, cover with boiling water and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok or large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add garlic, ginger and scallions and stir-fry for a minute until fragrant.
Add sauces and stir-fry for a further 2 minutes.
Add stock and bring to a simmer.
Add green beans, edamame and tofu, tossing to coat with the sauce. Reduce heat and gently simmer for 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens and vegetables are tender.
Drain noodles and divide between serving bowls. Add stir-fry and scatter over extra scallions to serve.

name: Baked Turkey Meatballs with Sautéed Kale & Pistachio
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked & finely chopped
4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) rye bread (or gluten free) toasted
1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves stripped & finely sliced
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a medium bowl, combine ground turkey, vinegar, syrup, garlic and mint and season with salt and pepper. Mix well with your hands and form into golf-sized balls.
Heat half the oil in an oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat and sauté meatballs for 5-6 minutes, turning occasionally, until browned. Set aside.
In the same skillet, over medium heat, sauté onion, fennel seeds and chilli for 2 minutes. Add stock and tomatoes and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. Adjust seasoning.
Place browned meatballs on top of sauce and bake for 12 minutes, turning meatballs halfway through.

In the last 5 minutes of cooking, heat another skillet over medium heat. Add remaining oil and sauté kale and pistachios for a few minutes until kale has just wilted. Add an extra splash of vinegar, season and remove from heat.
Top meatballs with parmesan and serve with sautéed kale and toasted rye bread.

name: Burger Salad Bowl with Honey Mustard Dressing
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 410°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Place potatoes in a saucepan of cold salted water, bring to the boil and simmer for 6-8 minutes, or until just beginning to soften. Drain well, returning to the hot saucepan for a few minutes to remove all moisture. Place on baking sheet, spray with oil, season with salt and pepper and bake for 10-15 minutes or until golden.
At the same time, combine dressing ingredients together in a small bowl, adding water to thin if needed and set aside.
In a bowl, combine beef, garlic and chilli and season to taste. With wet hands, roll into patties.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat, and cook patties for 3-4 minutes each side or until browned and cooked through. Set aside.
Crack eggs into skillet and cook to your liking.
Divide lettuce, tomato, pickles and avocado between bowls, top with pattie and egg, drizzle over dressing and serve with wedges.

name: Mushroom & Lentil Patties
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 cans of lentils (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
1⁄3 cup (45g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1 lemon half squeezed & half cut in wedges
preparation: Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion for 5 minutes until soft. Add garlic and mushrooms and cook for a further 5 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl and add cumin, coriander, lentils, egg, breadcrumbs and flour. Season with salt and pepper and mix to combine. Form into 6 patties.
Wipe out skillet with paper towel and heat over a medium heat. Cook patties for 4-5 minutes each side, until golden and set aside in a warm place.
At the same time, divide lettuce and tomatoes between plates.
Add halloumi to skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes each side until golden and soft.
Top salad with halloumi, squeeze over lemon and season with pepper. Add patties to plates and serve with tzatziki.

name: Leftover Turkey & Ham Filo Pies
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 1⁄2 tbs (25g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1⁄4 cup (65ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
8 sheets of filo pastry (or gluten free)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Melt butter in a non-stick saucepan over low heat. Add flour and stir constantly for 1 minute until mixture begins to bubble. Gradually whisk in some of the stock to form a smooth paste. Add remaining stock and milk and continue to cook, stirring for a further 2 minutes until thickened.
Add mustard, turkey, ham, peas, parsley and mix to combine. Season with salt and pepper and set aside to cool.

Take one sheet of filo, spray with oil and place another sheet on top. Spoon 1⁄4 of the pie mixture onto the filo at one short end. Fold up the sides and roll up to make a parcel, brushing with water to seal the edges. Transfer to baking sheet and repeat with remaining filo and pie mixture.
Spray pies with oil and bake for 25 minutes until golden and crisp and serve with salad greens and feta.

name: Pesto & Mushroom Pita Pizza
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 large (3 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita breads or pockets (or gluten free)
1 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) (reserve 2 sprigs)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a large baking sheet with baking paper.
Wrap tofu in a few layers of paper towel and press under a weight to remove water.

To make pesto, place the spinach in a bowl and cover with boiling water and stir until wilted. Drain. Transfer to a small food processor, add all remaining ingredients and 1⁄4 cup water. Blend until smooth and combined. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Crumble tofu into skillet, breaking up any large pieces with a wooden spoon. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes until tofu is golden. Add mushrooms and cook for a further 5 minutes until tender. Remove from heat.
Place pita onto tray and spread each with pesto. Arrange tofu and mushrooms over the top and sprinkle with cheese. Season with salt and pepper and bake for 10 minutes until crisp.
Cut into wedges and serve garnished with reserved basil leaves.

name: Mushroom & Tofu Fajita Bowl
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 large (1 1/2 oz ea) corn tortillas warmed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & roughly chopped
preparation: Toss tofu with half the oil in a medium bowl. Add garlic and spices, season with salt and pepper and toss again to coat.
Combine guacamole ingredients, lightly mashing avocado and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, add tofu and cook until golden and crispy all over. Remove tofu and set aside.
Heat remaining oil in skillet, add onion and bell pepper and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook for a few more minutes to soften. Adjust seasoning.
Divide onion mixture, tofu, cabbage and guacamole between bowls and serve with lime wedges and warm tortillas.

name: Sheet-Pan Salmon & Roasted Vegetables
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 bunch of (160g) asparagus cut in half
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking dish with baking paper.
Toss potato with half the oil, season and bake on tray for 10 minutes.
Toss zucchini, red onion and garlic with remaining oil, season and add to baking dish with potatoes. Bake for a further 10 minutes.
Season salmon with salt and pepper and add to tray of vegetables along with asparagus and cherry tomatoes. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the salmon is just cooked through.
Squeeze over half the lemon, scatter over basil leaves and serve with remaining lemon cut in wedges.

name: Greek Lamb Platter
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 head of baby romaine lettuce leaves picked
2 large (3 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita breads or pockets (or gluten free) toasted & cut in triangles
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Brush potato wedges with half the oil and season with salt and pepper. Scatter over baking sheet and roast for 40-45 minutes or until golden.

Meanwhile, preheat a BBQ or non-stick griddle pan over medium-high heat. Brush lamb with remaining oil, season and sprinkle over oregano. Cook lamb for 3-4 minutes each side for medium, or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate, cover loosely and rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
Place lamb on a platter, squeeze over some lemon juice and scatter over onion and parsley. Arrange tomatoes, lettuce, feta, pita and remaining lemon on the platter to serve.

name: Grilled Chicken with Broccoli Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 1⁄4 cups (225g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1⁄2 head of broccoli (12 oz head) thinly sliced, including stems
preparation: To start salad, place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Simmer, covered for 15 minutes or until cooked. Stir through broccoli, cover and stand for 5 minutes. Spread on a plate to cool.
Rub chicken with oil and garlic and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and cook chicken for about 3-4 minutes each side, until cooked. Remove chicken from heat and allow to rest for a minute.
In a serving bowl, whisk together mayonnaise and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add quinoa, broccoli, almonds and dill and gently toss. Adjust seasoning and top with shaved parmesan.
Divide chicken and salad between plates to serve.

name: Easy Bolognese Zoodles
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
preparation: Heat oil in a medium sized saucepan over medium heat, add onion and cook for 5 minutes, or until soft.

Add beef and cook until just browned. Add garlic and tomato paste and cook for a minute, stirring well. Add tomatoes, water, basil and salt, bring to the boil and simmer over low heat for 15-20 minutes.

Cook pasta according to packet directions, drain and toss with zoodles and sauce to serve.
Note: The sauce can be made well ahead of serving but due to the high water content of zucchini it is best to make the zoodles just prior to eating. If not possible, simply drain off water before eating.

name: Christmas Glazed Ham
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (75g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
900g sweet potatoes peeled & cut into wedges
2 bunches of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) trimmed
preparation: Preheat oven to  355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place tomato puree, honey, mustard, vinegar, Worcestershire and garlic in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2 minutes, stirring, until well combined. Remove from heat.

Score ham lightly in a diamond pattern with a sharp knife and transfer to a shallow roasting dish. Pour 1⁄2 cup of water into the dish and brush the ham with glaze. Roast for 40 minutes, basting with glaze every 10 minutes, until caramelized.
At the same time, place sweet potato onto baking sheet and toss with half the oil. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 35 minutes.

Meanwhile, 10 minutes before ham is cooked, cook broccolini and asparagus in a large saucepan of salted boiling water for 2-3 minutes until crisp tender, or cooked to your liking. Drain, toss with remaining olive oil and season to taste.
Slice ham and serve with vegetables.

name: Sheet-Pan Curried Chicken with Coconut Sauce
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked
4 small (2 oz ea) wholewheat pita bread or pockets (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F and line a baking dish with baking paper.
Place broccoli, cauliflower, chicken, oil, curry powder and salt and pepper in a large bowl and toss well to coat.
Transfer to dish and bake for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is completely cooked through and juices run clear.

Meanwhile, prepare sauce. In a small saucepan set over medium-low heat, combine all sauce ingredients. Bring to a bare simmer, then immediately remove from heat, set aside and season with salt and pepper.
To serve top chicken and vegetables with cilantro and serve with pita bread and sauce.
Note: to make your own curry powder use equal parts cumin, cayenne, turmeric and black pepper.

name: Turkey Scaloppine with Roasted Carrot Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 sprig of fresh rosemary leaves stripped & finely chopped
1 bunch of baby carrots (7 oz trimmed bunch)
1 1⁄4 cups (225g) mixed quinoa (or other color) rinsed
400g turkey breast cut in 1/2 inch thick slices horizontally
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Combine maple syrup, half the rosemary, salt and pepper and toss with carrots. Place on sheet and roast for 30-35 minutes or until golden and tender.

Meanwhile, place quinoa and water in a saucepan, season with salt and bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes or until cooked. Rest covered for 5 minutes before spreading on a plate to cool.
Season turkey. Heat butter in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Once foaming, add turkey and cook for 2 minutes each side, or until cooked. Set aside in a warm place.
In the same hot skillet, make a sauce by adding stock and remaining rosemary to deglaze. Scrape any bits from the bottom of the skillet and cook for a few minutes to reduce.
Toss cooled quinoa, carrots, arugula and feta together.
Divide quinoa and turkey scallopini between plates and serve with sauce.

name: Ribollita (Tuscan Vegetable Soup)
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) stems finely chopped & leaves picked
1⁄2 bunch of cavolo nero (or Tuscan kale) (12 oz bunch) leaves stripped from stem, stems chopped & leaves shredded, separately
2 cans of cannellini beans (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
3 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) stale, torn into large pieces
preparation: Heat a large non-stick saucepan over medium heat and cook pancetta, stirring for 2 minutes until fat begins to render into pan.
Add onion, celery, carrot, parsley stems and kale stems and sauté for 5 minutes until onion is soft.
Add tomato puree, stock and cannellini beans. Bring to a simmer, cover and cook for 15 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Add kale leaves and bread and simmer uncovered for a further 8 minutes until the bread is very soft and the soup has thickened. Adjust seasoning.
Divide between serving bowls and top with chopped parsley to serve.

name: Whole Snapper with Lime, Chilli & Ginger
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
ingredients: 1 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked, stems set aside
1 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked, stems set aside
80g fresh ginger skin removed, roughly chopped
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat the oven to 390°F.
Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Meanwhile, soak mint stems in boiling water for 20 seconds. Drain and combine with cilantro stems and remaining marinade ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth.
Score fish on each side and rub thoroughly with the marinade. Wrap the fish in baking paper and foil and bake for 40 - 45 minutes.
To make the dressing, whisk all ingredients together in a small bowl.
Meanwhile combine mint and cilantro leaves with remaining salad ingredients and toss with dressing.
Divide fish between plates and serve with salad and rice.

name: Red Lentil Dal
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked
preparation: Heat oil in a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and sauté for 5 minutes until soft.
Add ginger, garlic and spices and cook for a further minute until fragrant.
Add lentils, stock and coconut milk and simmer for 20 minutes until the lentils are tender and dal has thickened. Stir through spinach leaves until wilted and adjust seasoning.
Divide dal between serving bowls, top with yogurt and scatter over cilantro to serve.

name: BBQ Shrimp with Mango Salsa
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 cup (180g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes or until cooked, rest covered for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Meanwhile, to make the salsa place all ingredients in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Set aside at room temperatures.
Preheat a barbecue or non-stick griddle pan over medium-high heat. Thread shrimp onto skewers, brush with oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes each side, or until just cooked.
Divide quinoa between plates and top with shrimp and mango salsa to serve.

name: Salmon Burgers with Quick Slaw
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 400g salmon fillets skin removed and finely chopped into 1/2 inch pieces or smaller
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) sprigs roughly chopped
preparation: To make the burgers, combine salmon, egg, scallion and ginger and season with salt and pepper.
Place breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Form salmon mixture into patties and toss in seasoned breadcrumbs to coat.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook patties until golden, about 5 minutes each side. Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
At the same time, to make the slaw, whisk lemon juice, zest and honey together in a large bowl and season with salt and pepper. Add remaining ingredients and toss well.
Toast buns and top with pattie and slaw to serve.

name: Chorizo & Bean Stew
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Place chorizo, onion and bell pepper in a non-stick saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook for 5 minutes until onion is soft and chorizo has begun to crisp.
Add tomatoes, beans, lentils, paprika and oregano and bring to the boil. Reduce to a low simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes until reduced and thickened. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Divide between bowls, scatter over parsley, top with yogurt and serve with sourdough.

name: Middle Eastern Baked Eggs with Chickpeas
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 red bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
1 1⁄2 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped, to serve
2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted, to serve
preparation: Heat oil in a medium skillet fitted with a lid, over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper and garlic stirring occasionally for 5-10 minutes, or until vegetables are soft.
Add the spice, tomatoes and chickpeas and simmer, covered for a further 5 minutes until tomato is soft. Adjust seasoning.
Use a spoon to make indentations in the sauce, crack an egg into each and sprinkle over cheese. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 5-8 minutes until egg is cooked to your liking.
Season eggs with salt and pepper, scatter over parsley and serve with sourdough bread.

name: Stuffed Mushrooms
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 3 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves picked, chopped
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Trim mushroom stalks at the base and finely chop the stalks. Place mushrooms caps on sheet, stalk side up and set aside.
Heat oil in a medium size non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, thyme and mushroom stalks and cook for 5 minutes until onion is soft. Remove from heat.
At the same time place tofu in a bowl and mash with a fork. Add cheese, lentils, rice and onion mixture, season with salt and pepper and mix well.
Divide mixture evenly between mushroom caps and roast for 20 minutes, until mushrooms are tender and the filling is golden and crunchy.

name: Grilled Squash, Mozzarella & Marjoram Pizza
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 large (3 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita breads or pockets (or gluten free)
200g butternut squash very thinly sliced or shaved
preparation: Preheat oven and pizza tray or stone to 430°F.
Spread tomato paste evenly over pita and top with mozzarella, onion, squash, pine nuts and marjoram. Season with salt and pepper.
Bake 10-15 minutes, until golden.
Top with arugula to serve.

name: Rainbow Macro Bowl
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 1⁄4 cups (225g) mixed quinoa (or other color) rinsed
4 red radishes thinly sliced on a mandolin
preparation: Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Simmer, covered for 10 minutes. Place broccoli on top of quinoa to steam and continue to cook quinoa and broccoli for another 5 minutes. Rest covered for 5 minutes.
At the same time, place tofu on a plate lined with paper towel. Cover tofu with more paper towel and press down gently to absorb as much liquid as possible. Set aside.
Heat oil a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cut tofu into thin triangles and cook for 2 minutes each side until golden. Transfer to a plate.
Place sesame seeds on a saucer and press avocado in to coat one side.
Divide quinoa and broccoli between bowls and arrange tofu, avocado, carrot, cabbage and radish around the bowls. Squeeze over lime and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Fish Burger with Yogurt Tartar Sauce
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 medium (2 1/2oz) wholegrain/wholewheat (or gluten free)rolls cut in half
preparation: To make tartar place all ingredients in a small bowl and mix well to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook fish for 3 minutes each side, or until cooked through.

To assemble burgers, toss cabbage with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Spread tartare on the base of each roll. Top with tomato, fish, avocado, cabbage and the other half of roll to serve.

name: Wholesome Chicken Noodle Soup
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
preparation: Heat oil in a non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Season chicken and cook for 4 minutes, turning until browned. Remove chicken from pan and set aside. Add onion, celery and carrot and cook, stirring for 5-10 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook for a further minute. Return chicken to pan and add stock. Bring to a simmer, cover and cook for 20 minutes until chicken is tender.
Meanwhile, cook the noodles according to packet directions. Drain and divide between serving bowls.

Add the corn and baby spinach and stir until the spinach has just wilted. Remove from heat. Transfer chicken to a plate and shred the meat then divide between serving bowls. Ladle the soup over the chicken and noodles and top with scallions, parsley and salt and pepper.

name: Tofu Red Curry with Noodles
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
1 cayenne chilli pepper sliced, seeds optional
preparation: Heat a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Add curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.

Add stock, coconut milk, cauliflower and tofu and gently stir to combine. Cover with lid and cook for 7-8 minutes, then add the green beans and cook for another 4 minutes until vegetables are just tender. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Meanwhile, cook rice vermicelli according to packet instructions and drain.
Divide noodles and curry between bowls and top with cilantro, chilli pepper and a squeeze of lime to serve.

name: Greek Meatball (Keftedes) Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 medium (2 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita pockets (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Place beef, oregano, garlic and parsley in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Mix well to combine. Roll tablespoons of mixture into balls and refrigerate for 15 minutes.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add meatballs and cook, rolling around, for 5-6 minutes until browned and cooked through.
Gently toss salad ingredients together in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and divide between serving plates.
Scatter over feta, add meatballs and serve with torn pieces of pita bread and yogurt on the side.

name: Cauliflower Orecchiette
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place cauliflower onto sheet, season with salt and pepper and roast for 20 minutes until golden.
Meanwhile, cook orecchiette in a large saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions. Once cooked, reserve 1⁄4 cup of pasta water then drain.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Crumble in tofu and cook, stirring after a few minutes for 4-5 minutes until browned and crisp. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Add cauliflower, chickpeas, lemon juice, capers, basil, cooked pasta and reserved pasta water. Stir well to combine.
Divide between plates and top with almonds, extra basil and pepper to serve.

name: Salmon Frittata with Swiss Chard
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of swiss chard (1 1/2 lb bunch) trimmed & sliced (stalks and leaves separately)
4 sprigs of dill chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet and a 8 inch x 8 inch square cake tin with baking paper.
Place sweet potato on baking sheet, season with salt and pepper and roast for 20 minutes, or until tender.

Meanwhile, heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add Swiss chard stalks and sauté for 4-5 minutes until soft. Add leaves and cook for a further minute until wilted. Remove from heat.
Whisk eggs in a bowl. Add cheese and dill, season with salt and pepper and mix to combine.
Arrange sweet potato, Swiss chard and salmon in prepared cake tin. Pour over egg mixture and bake for 20-25 minutes until set.

Toss leaves with lemon juice, season with salt and pepper and serve with frittata.

NOTE: Store any remaining frittata in an airtight container in the fridge for 3 days.

name: Vietnamese Beef Vermicelli Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 Lebanese cucumber cut in half & thinly sliced diagonally
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked
1 small red chilli pepper finely chopped
preparation: Soak noodles in hot water according to packet instructions. Drain.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a wok or large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add lemongrass and stir fry for a minute until fragrant.
Add beef and stir fry for 5 minutes until browned and cooked. Add fish sauce, honey and lime juice, toss to combine and remove from heat.
Divide lettuce between serving plates. Top with drained noodles, beef, cucumber, bean shoots, mint leaves and chilli. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Steak & Roasted Potatoes with Herb Vinaigrette
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1.2kg fingerling potatoes cut in half lengthways
3 sprigs of fresh rosemary leaves picked & chopped
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
1 sprig of fresh rosemary leaves stripped & chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 425°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss potatoes with half of the oil, rosemary leaves and season with salt and pepper. Spread on baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes.
Season steaks all over with salt and rest for 15 minutes. Then drizzle both sides with remaining oil and season with pepper.
Meanwhile, heat a grill or griddle pan on high heat. Grill steaks, turning every 15 seconds for about 4 minutes, or until cooked to your liking.
Allow steaks to rest for at least 5-10 minutes to lock in flavor.
For the vinaigrette, combine all ingredients in a bowl or jar. Shake or stir well to combine.
Divide potatoes and leaves tossed with carrot between plates, add steak and drizzle with dressing to serve.

name: Spinach & Cheese Lasagna
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 bunch of English spinach (14 oz bunch) trimmed & washed
1⁄4 cup (35g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
2 cups (500ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and grease a 8 x 6 inch deep baking dish.

Blanch the spinach in a saucepan of boiling water for 30-60 seconds until just wilted. Drain. Once cool enough to handle, squeeze out as much water as you can with your hands, then transfer to a board and chop finely.

Heat butter in a large non-stick skillet over low-medium heat. Once melted, add flour and cook for 1-2 minutes. Whisk in milk until smooth and cook on low for 3 minutes until thickened. Add nutmeg and season with salt and pepper. Add chopped spinach, cottage cheese, ricotta, basil and 2⁄3 of the parmesan. Mix to combine.

To assemble lasagna, place a ladle of spinach and cheese mixture in the base of a medium-sized baking dish. Cover with lasagna sheets then continue layering with spinach mixture and lasagna sheets, finishing with a layer of spinach and remaining parmesan cheese.
Cover with baking paper and foil and bake for 20 minutes, remove covers and bake for a further 10 minutes until golden and cooked.
Serve topped with extra basil leaves.

name: Lemon & Garlic Fish with Broccolini Quinoa
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (270g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) trimmed & halved lengthways down the stem
preparation: Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes or until cooked, rest covered for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Heat a non-stick skillet over low heat and toast almonds, tossing regularly until golden. Set aside.
Meanwhile, place garlic, lemon zest and olive oil in a small bowl and mix to combine. Place fish fillets on a plate and coat in garlic mixture.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook fish for 3 minutes a side, or until just cooked. Transfer fish to a plate. Add stock, lemon juice and broccolini to skillet and allow to simmer for 2 minutes until broccolini is crisp and sauce has reduced slightly. Transfer broccolini to a board and chop into small pieces.
Toss toasted almonds with quinoa and broccolini. Divide between plates and top with fish and sauce. Scatter over parsley and serve with extra lemon wedges.

name: Best Chicken Stock
servings: This method is based on 20 servings
ingredients: 1 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roots only, roughly pounded but kept intact
