1 garlic bulb unpeeled & cut in half
4 stalks of lemongrass soft white inner flesh, pounded roughly
preparation: Add filter bag ingredients to muslin bag and combine with stock ingredients in a large 10-12 litre stock pot.

Set your stock on the stove range on a low rolling bowl- this should take approximately 2-4 hours. Broths are personal - keep in mind the longer it’s on the heat the deeper the flavours. If you braised the chicken feet for longer than 4 hours it will not be intact.
Strain, add seasoning ingredients to taste and use as required or freeze.

name: Lamb Patties with Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) leaves picked
2 large (3 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita breads or pockets (or gluten free) torn into pieces
preparation: Place cucumber, tomatoes, radish, parsley and lemon juice in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
Arrange pita bread on a baking tray and bake for 5 minutes until crisp and set aside to cool.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion, carrot and zucchini and cook for 5-6 minutes until soft. Transfer to a bowl to cool slightly.
Add lamb, egg and cumin to the cooled vegetables, season with salt and pepper and mix well to combine. Form into patties.
Wipe skillet clean and return to medium heat. Cook patties for 8 minutes, turning once, or until cooked through.
Top salad with crisp bread and serve with patties.

name: Chicken Pot Pies
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 reduced-fat, frozen shortcrust pastry(or gluten-free) sheet thawed
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.
Meanwhile, heat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken for 5 minutes until browned. Add leek, garlic, thyme and mushrooms and cook for a further 3-4 minutes until soft.

Add stock and broccoli and simmer for 5-10 minutes until stock reduces by half. Remove from heat. Add cream cheese and season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine and divide between 8 fl oz ramekins.
Cut out 4 circles of pastry, slightly larger than the ramekins. You may need to roll the pastry out a little.

Brush edges of ramekins with beaten egg and top each with pastry, pressing the edges to seal. Brush with beaten egg and scatter over sesame seeds. Make a small slit in the centre to allow steam to escape.
Place ramekins on a baking tray and bake for 20 minutes or until golden.

name: Slow-Roasted Lamb with Celery & Pine Nut Salsa
servings: This method is based on 8 servings
ingredients: 1 2⁄3 cups (400ml) vegetable stock or bone broth
2 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
1 head of cauliflower (2 lb head) broken into florets
100g currants softened in boiling water for 20 mins, then drained
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) finely chopped
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & finely chopped
1 tbs (30g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat the oven to 390°F.

To roast lamb, place onion, carrot, celery, garlic, thyme and rosemary in the bottom of a large, deep roasting pan. Add lamb, season with salt and pepper and drizzle with oil.  Add stock to pan and roast, uncovered for 30 minutes. Reduce oven to 320°F, cover pan with foil and cook for a further 4 hours. Remove lamb from pan, loosely cover with foil and set aside in a warm place to rest.

To make the cauliflower mash, add cauliflower to a saucepan cover with water and bring to the boil. Simmer for about 8-10 minutes, or until tender, strain cooking water and reserve 1⁄2 cup. Add  sufficient reserved water to make a smooth mash or blend in a food processor. Adjust seasoning, drizzle with oil and set aside.

To make the salsa, sauté oil, celery and pine nuts in a large non-stick skillet on medium-high for about 4-5 min until celery is translucent and pine nuts are toasted. Remove from heat, add olives, drained currants, parsley, mint, honey, lemon juice and zest and mix well.  Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside.
Place peas in a saucepan of boiling salted water and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Drain and toss with mint leaves.
Scatter extra lemon juice, zest and parsley on the roast lamb and serve with cauliflower mash, pine nut salsa and peas.

name: Creamed Leeks with Chives
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
preparation: Heat a medium sized non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add oil and leeks and cook for 5-10 minutes until wilted and translucent.
Stir through vinegar, season with salt and pepper and cook for a few minutes more. Stir through yogurt and chives to serve.

name: Baked Whole Snapper with Cardamom Carrots & Creamed Leeks
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
ingredients: 2 lemons one juiced and one sliced
3 bunches of baby carrots (7 oz trimmed bunch) assorted colors & trimmed
1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 tbs (40g) butter (or dairy-free alternative) or vegan butter
1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a large baking sheet with baking paper (allowing enough hang-over to wrap the fish).
To prepare snapper, combine lemon juice, half the thyme sprigs, garlic and salt and pepper and place in the cavity.

Place fish on baking paper, season with salt and pepper and top with lemon slices, tomatoes and remaining thyme, then pour over the wine. Bring two edges of paper together over the top of the fish, triple fold and tuck top and ends underneath to seal fish in the package. Bake fish until cooked through, about 35 minutes.

Meanwhile, prepare carrots, toss with maple syrup, oil, cardamom and salt and spread in a single layer over a baking paper lined baking sheet. Roast for 10 minutes, turn and continue to cook for another 10 minutes.

To make vinaigrette for the carrots whilst they're cooking, heat butter in a small non-stick skillet over low heat until beginning to turn golden. Remove from heat, stir through shallots and garlic and set aside for 5 minutes. Whisk in vinegar, oil, mustard, most of the parsley and season with salt and pepper. Toss with carrots and scatter over remaining parsley.

To cook leeks, heat a medium sized non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add oil and leeks and cook for 5-10 minutes until wilted and translucent.
Stir through vinegar, season with salt and pepper and cook for a few minutes more. Stir through yogurt and chives to serve.
Divide fish, cardamom carrots and creamed leeks between plates, adjust seasonings to serve.

name: White Fish with Lemon Caper Sauce & Brown Rice
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 500g white fish fillets skinless (cod or tilapia)
250g asparagus trimmed & cut same length as the fish
2 garlic cloves minced or finely chopped
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F and layer 2 large pieces of baking paper on a baking sheet.
Combine rice and water in a saucepan, bring to the boil, cover and simmer for 25-30 minutes. Stand for 5 minutes, fluff with a fork and season with salt.
At the same time, place fish and asparagus on baking sheet, drizzle with half the oil, season with salt and pepper and top fish with lemon slices.
Wrap paper tightly over fish to ensure moisture can’t escape and bake for 12-15 minutes or until cooked through but still tender.*

Heat remaining oil in a non-stick skillet over low heat. Add capers and garlic and cook stirring for 2 minutes, until garlic is a slightly golden color. Remove from heat, allow to cool slightly and stir through lemon juice.
Divide rice, fish and asparagus between plates, drizzle with sauce and scatter over parsley to serve.

*Chefs Tip: to test if fish is cooked, insert a fork in thickest part of the fish and touch fork on your bottom lip. If cold it’s not cooked, if piercing hot it’s over cooked. You want it to be warm to hot.

name: Lemon & Thyme Roast Chicken
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 3 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves stripped
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking dish with baking paper.
Scatter onion in a single layer over the prepared dish.
Combine oil, thyme, garlic, lemon zest and salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add sweet potato and chicken and toss well to coat.
Arrange potates and chicken over onion layer and pour over any remaining oil. Roast for 20 minutes.
Add lemon slices to the chicken and potatoes and return dish to the oven for 15-20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender.
In the last 5 minutes of roasting, cook beans in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender. Drain.
To serve, divide chicken, onion, sweet potato and lemon slices between plates and serve with green beans.

name: Greek-Style Baked Fish with Salad
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄2 tsp dried oregano or more to taste
1 lemon 1/2 zested & juiced, 1/2 cut in wedges
3 large (3 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita breads or pockets (or gluten free) torn into pieces
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

In a large bowl mix together oregano, lemon zest, oil and season with salt and pepper. Add fish and toss to coat. Transfer fish to baking sheet and pour over any remaining marinade. Bake for 10-12 minutes until fish is just cooked. Add bread to sheet for last 5 minutes to crisp.
Meanwhile, place cucumber, tomato, olives and lemon juice in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
Divide salad between plates, crumble over feta and serve with fish, pita bread and lemon wedges.

name: Roast Cauliflower Risotto
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves picked & finely chopped (plus extra to serve)
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss cauliflower with 1 teaspoon of oil, season with salt and pepper, scatter over baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes until golden and tender.
Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a non-stick saucepan over medium heat,  add onion, garlic and thyme and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until soft.

Add rice and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add stock a ladle at a time, and cook stirring, for 20 minutes, gradually adding more stock once it has been absorbed until rice is cooked al dente. Remove from heat, stir through parmesan and adjust seasoning.
Divide risotto between serving bowls and top with roasted cauliflower, hazelnuts and extra thyme to serve.

name: Chilli Soy Brussels Sprouts & Tofu
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 cayenne chilli pepper reserve a few slices to serve & finely chopped remainder
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 35 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Meanwhile, whisk sauce ingredients together and set aside.
Place tofu on a plate lined with paper towel. Cover with more paper towel and press down gently to absorb as much liquid as you can. Cut into cubes.
Heat oil in a wok or large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu and stir-fry for 2 minutes until golden around the edges. Transfer to plate.

Add brussels sprouts to wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until caramelized. Add sauce and cook for a further 2 minutes until brussels sprouts are bright green and crisp tender. Return tofu to wok and toss to coat with sauce.
Divide rice between bowls and top with brussels sprouts, tofu, scallions and chilli pepper slices to serve.

name: Roasted Cardamom Carrots with Brown Butter Vinaigrette
servings: This method is based on 6 servings
ingredients: 3 bunches of baby carrots (7 oz trimmed bunch) assorted colors & trimmed
1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 410°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss carrots with maple syrup, oil, cardamom and salt and spread in a single layer over baking sheet. Roast for 10 minutes, turn and continue to cook for another 10 minutes.

Whilst carrots are cooking, heat butter in a small skillet over low heat until beginning to turn golden. Remove from heat, stir through shallot and garlic and set aside for 5 minutes. Whisk in vinegar, oil, mustard, most of the parsley and season with salt and pepper.
Toss carrots with vinaigrette and scatter over remaining parsley to serve.

name: One-Pan Lamb Roast Chops
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 sprigs of fresh rosemary leaves picked, chopped
400g lamb cutlets, all fat removed fully trimmed
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a large oven proof dish with baking paper.
In a large bowl, mix together lemon juice, oil, rosemary, garlic and season with salt and pepper. Add wedges, toss well and spread over the base of the dish.
Toss chops to coat in remaining mixture and arrange over the wedges. Roast for 20-25 minutes or until potatoes are almost cooked and chops are beginning to brown.
Scatter zucchini and tomatoes over dish and roast for a further 5-8 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
Divide lamb and vegetables between plates and squeeze over extra lemon to serve.

name: Roast Veggie & Hummus Bowl
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 450g butternut squash cut in small wedges & seeds cleaned
150g brussels sprouts trimmed & cut in half
1⁄2 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves stripped from rib and finely sliced
2 cups (320g) microwave brown rice prepared according to packet directions
preparation: Preheat oven to 430°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Season butternut squash, seeds and beetroot with salt & pepper. Arrange separately on baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes.
Brush tempeh with a small amount of oil and add to sheet. Toss brussels sprouts and leek with remaining oil and also add to sheet. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Add kale and broccoli, arranged separately, to sheet with other vegetables and continue to roast for another 10 minutes or until cooked. Season with salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, combine hummus and lemon juice and adjust seasoning.
Divide rice and vegetables between bowls, top with hummus, tempeh, seeds and alfalfa.

name: Spicy Indian Chicken & Tomato Curry
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 onion thinly sliced into half moons
1 lime cut into wedges, to serve
2 3⁄4 cups (500g) mixed quinoa (or other color) rinsed
3⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) reserve a few sprigs for serving and roughly chop the remainder
1 small green chilli pepper trimmed, deseeded & roughly chopped
preparation: Place chicken in a bowl, season with salt and pepper, toss to combine and set aside.
Blend spice paste ingredients to a paste and set aside.
Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered for 15 minutes or until cooked. Rest covered for 5 minutes then fluff with a fork.

At the same time heat a non-stick saucepan over medium heat, add oil and cook onion for 5 minutes until soft. Add spice paste and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes until fragrant. Add chicken, tomatoes, coconut milk and water. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes then scatter over beans and cook for a further 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide quinoa and curry between serving bowls and top with reserved cilantro and lime wedges to serve.

name: Creamy Lemon Chicken with Potatoes
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped, to serve
preparation: Cook potatoes in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 10 minutes, or until soft in the centre when pierced with a knife. Drain.
Meanwhile, season chicken with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook chicken for 2-3 minutes a side until browned and cooked. Set aside.

Add butter and garlic to skillet and cook for 30 seconds, then add the wine and allow it to bubble and reduce by half. Add lemon juice and zest and season with salt and pepper. Bring back to a simmer, add yogurt and return chicken and any resting juices to skillet and heat for 1-2 minutes.
Divide chicken and potatoes between plates and top with parsley. Serve with salad leaves tossed with avocado on the side.

name: Sweet Potato Gnocchi with Spicy Tomato Sugo
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
1 cup (135g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
preparation: To make gnocchi, pierce sweet potato all over with a fork and microwave on HIGH for 8-10 minutes, turning halfway, until tender. Cut in half, lengthways, scoop flesh out and spread on a plate to cool.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat and cook onion, stirring for 4 minutes until soft. Add garlic and chilli and cook for another minute.
Add tomato sauce, bring to a simmer and cook uncovered for 10 minutes until reduced and thickened slightly. Season with salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, blend cooled potato with ricotta, grated parmesan, egg yolk, nutmeg and salt and pepper. Gently mix in flour until just combined. Don’t overwork it or the dough will toughen.
Transfer to a lightly floured bench, divide into four and roll into cylinders, adding more flour if too sticky. With a sharp knife, cut into 1 inch pieces. Repeat with remaining dough.
Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil and cook gnocchi for 2 minutes or until they float to the surface.
Transfer to serving bowl or divide between plates, top with sauce, shaved parmesan and basil.

name: Stir-Fried Buckwheat with Kimchi & Eggs
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 150g green beans trimmed & cut into short lengths
1 tbs (20ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 cayenne chilli pepper thinly sliced, to serve
preparation: Place buckwheat and stock in a medium saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil and simmer for 8 minutes, or until tender. Drain and spread out on a tray to cool.
Heat oil in a wok or large non-stick skillet over medium to high heat. Fry half the eggs for 2 minutes until edges are crispy and white is set, or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate.

Add beans to wok and stir fry for 4-5 minutes until crisp-tender. Add edamame, kimchi and scallion and stir fry for 2-3 minutes until scallion are soft. Add buckwheat and tamari and stir fry for 2 minutes until heated through.

Push ingredients to the side of the wok. Beat remaining 2 eggs in a bowl and pour into wok. Allow to cook for 1-2 minutes until partially set then toss through buckwheat and vegetables for 1 minute until cooked through. Divide between bowls and top with fried eggs and chilli.

name: Spaghetti alla Puttanesca
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
1⁄4 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked
preparation: Cook spaghetti in a saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions (about 10-12 minutes). Drain.

Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook onion for 5 minutes until soft. Add garlic, anchovies and chilli and cook for another minute. Stir through tomatoes, lentils, stock, capers, olives, season with salt and pepper and simmer for 15 minutes or until lentils are cooked and sauce has thickened.
Toss through drained spaghetti and basil and divide between plates to serve.

name: Swedish Meatballs with Sweet Potato Mash
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
ingredients: 1.5kg sweet potatoes peeled & cut into 1 1/4 inch cubes
2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) processed to a crumb
preparation: Place sweet potato and salt in a saucepan, cover with water and simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain, reserving any cooking liquid. Mash potato, adding sufficient cooking water to combine.  Season to taste and keep warm.
Meanwhile, combine meat, egg, onion, bread crumbs and half the dill in a bowl and season to your liking. Roll mixture into meatballs using one tablespoon of mixture for each meatball.

Heat oil in a large non-stick frypan over medium heat, add meatballs and cook for 2-3 minutes until browned. You may need to work in batches depending on the size of your pan.  Remove meatballs from pan and set aside in a warm place.

Using the same pan, melt butter, sprinkle over cornstarch and whisk well to combine. Add a little stock, whisking until smooth. Gradually add the remaining stock and continue to whisk until smooth and sauce thickens.
Add meatballs and spinach to the pan, stirring to coat meatballs in sauce and continue to cook for a few minutes to warm through and wilt spinach.
Divide mash between plates, top with meatballs, season to your liking and scatter over remaining dill to serve.

name: Vegan Spaghetti alla Puttanesca
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
1⁄2 cup (100g) dried red lentils well rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked
preparation: Cook spaghetti in a saucepan of salted boiling water according to packet instructions (about 10-12 minutes). Drain.

Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook onion for 5 minutes until soft. Add garlic and chilli and cook for another minute. Stir through tomatoes, stock, lentils, nutritional yeast, capers, olives, season with salt and pepper and simmer for 15 minutes. Add a little pasta water if too thick.
Toss through drained spaghetti and basil and divide between plates to serve.

name: Sweet Potato Vegetarian Lasagna
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
ingredients: 1.5kg sweet potatoes peeled & very thinly sliced (1/8th inch)
2 cans of diced tomatoes (14 oz cans)
1⁄4 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked, for serving
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F.  Line a baking sheet with baking paper and grease a large ovenproof dish (about 9 x 14 inch) with a little oil.
Arrange sweet potato slices over baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.
At the same time make mushroom “bolognese”. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Once shimmering, add onion and garlic and sauté for 6 minutes or until onion is translucent.
Add mushrooms and tomatoes and cook another 3-4 minutes. Add tomato paste, miso paste and dried oregano and season liberally with salt and pepper.
Simmer over low heat for 10 minutes or until sauce is thick and fragrant. Set aside.
Whisk ricotta and cottage cheese together, season with salt & pepper and set aside.

Spread 1⁄4 of the mushroom sauce over the bottom of the prepared dish. Layer a 1⁄4 of the sweet potato slices over the sauce and then spread 1⁄4 of the cheese sauce over the potatoes. Continue layering in this order, another 3 times, until all ingredients are used.

Form a tent with foil to loosely cover the dish, and bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil, top with parmesan, rotate the dish, and bake another 20-25 minutes until the lasagna is bubbling and fork-tender all the way through.
Allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving. Scatter over fresh basil and eat!

name: Sweet Potato Skillet Hash
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper deseeded & 1/2 inch diced
2 cans of lentils (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
preparation: In a skillet, heat olive oil until simmering over medium-low heat. Add onions and garlic and cook for 8-10 minutes until completely soft and translucent. Season well with salt, pepper, cumin and cayenne.

Add sweet potato and bell pepper, and cook for another 10 minutes or until sweet potato is almost completely cooked through. Add lentils and stir to heat through. Make 6 small wells in the mixture and add eggs one by one. Cook eggs for 5 or more minutes until whites are set completely.
Remove skillet from heat and top with fresh cilantro to serve.

name: Lamb Souvlaki
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
4 medium (2 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita pockets (or gluten free)
preparation: Whisk lemon juice, honey, garlic, oregano and salt and pepper in a bowl. Add lamb, toss to coat and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes or longer, tossing regularly. Thread lamb onto 2 skewers.
Heat a BBQ or large non-stick griddle pan. Cook skewers for 6-8 minutes until caramelized and just cooked. Rest for 5 minutes.

To assemble souvlaki, spread tzatziki down the centre of each pita bread, leaving a 1 inch gap at one end to fold up. Arrange lettuce, tomato and parsley over top. Slide lamb off the skewers and arrange over salad. Fold over the bottom and sides to serve.

name: Roast Chicken with Vegetables
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 600g fingerling potatoes scrubbed & cut into wedges
500g sweet potatoes scrubbed & cut in wedges
1 bunch of baby carrots (7 oz trimmed bunch)
1 sprig of rosemary leaves picked & finely chopped
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 335°F .
Place vegetables, oil and rosemary in a heavy-based roasting dish. Season with salt and pepper, toss well to coat and spread out in dish.
Season the chicken with salt and pepper and place chicken thighs over the top of the vegetables. Roast for 40 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and chicken is cooked.
To serve, divide chicken and vegetables between serving plates and top with fresh parsley.

name: Mexican-Inspired Chickpea Omelette
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Once the omelettes are cooked, serve topped with chilli, sliced avocado, black beans, scallions, almonds and squeezed lime.

name: Indian Ground Beef with Naan Bread
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 4 medium (2 1/2 oz ea) naan bread (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook onion until golden, add garlic and ginger and cook, stirring for 1 minute.
Add ground beef, spices and salt and cook, stirring for 5-6 minutes until beef is browned. Add peas and cook, stirring for a further 5 minutes.
Divide beef between serving bowls and top with a dollop of yogurt, sprinkle over pomegranate seeds, fresh cilantro and chilli. Serve with warm naan bread.

name: Easy Eggplant Parmesan
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
4 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) torn into small pieces
3 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked, to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Cut the center of the eggplants in a crosshatch pattern and place on prepared sheet cut side up. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle over oil. Roast for 25 minutes until tender.
Place tomatoes in medium saucepan over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Season with salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes until reduced and thickened.
While the eggplants are cooking, spread out the torn bread on a baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes until lightly golden. Set aside.

Spread each eggplant with pesto, followed by tomato sauce, ricotta and mozzarella. Scatter over torn bread and return to the oven to bake for 5 minutes, or until golden and the cheese has melted. Serve with extra black pepper and top with fresh basil leaves.

name: Lancashire Hotpot
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 tbs all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
3 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves picked
3 sprigs of parsley finely chopped, to serve
1⁄4 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.

Season chops with salt and pepper and dust in flour to coat, shaking off excess. Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chops for 2 minutes a side until browned. Transfer to a medium ovenproof casserole dish.
Add onion and carrot to skillet and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook for a further minute until fragrant. Scatter mixture over chops.
Add thyme, bay leaf and chicken stock and layer potatoes over the top to completely cover the lamb. Season with salt and pepper and bake for 45 minutes or until lamb is cooked and potato is golden.
Meanwhile, combine salad ingredients in a small bowl. Toss and season with salt & pepper.
Divide hotpot between plates and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with salad on the side.

name: Gigantes with Tomatoes & Spinach
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 cans of crushed tomatoes (14 oz cans)
2 cans of butter beans (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
100g sourdough baguette (or gluten free) warmed, to serve
preparation: Heat oil in a medium non-stick saucepan over medium heat and cook onion for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic and tomato paste and cook for a further minute.
Add tomatoes, lentils, water, paprika, oregano and beans. Simmer for 15 minutes until tomatoes have broken down and sauce has reduced and thickened.
Stir through spinach and adjust seasoning.
Divide between bowls and serve with sourdough bread, to mop up the sauce.

name: Vibrant Slaw with Tahini Dressing
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) shredded
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook tempeh in batches till golden. Set aside.
To make dressing, whisk all ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.
Place the beetroot, kale, fennel, cilantro and chickpeas in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Divide between plates, add tempeh and drizzle over dressing to serve.

name: Bombay Chicken Pot Roast
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 2 large (4 oz ea) naan breads (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F.
Heat oil in a medium flameproof casserole dish over medium-high heat. Add chicken, brown all over and set aside.

Add onion to dish and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes until soft. Stir through curry paste and cook for another minute. Return chicken to dish with tomato, stir to coat with curry and cook for another minute.
Add stock, stir to combine and transfer to the oven and bake, uncovered for 25 minutes.
Add zucchini and bake for 5-7 minutes until zucchini is tender.
Stir through yogurt and spinach and adjust seasoning.
Divide between plates and serve with warm naan bread.

name: Vegetable Quesadillas
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper deseeded & thinly sliced
preparation: Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and bell pepper for 5 minutes, add zucchini and cook for a further 4-5 minutes until tender. Stir through baby spinach, season with salt and pepper and transfer to a large bowl to cool slightly.

Wipe out skillet and return over a medium heat. Place half the tortillas on a board and sprinkle with half the cheese. Top with vegetables, remaining cheese and tortillas. Transfer one of the quesadillas to the skillet and cook for 2 minutes each side until golden and cheese has melted. Repeat with remaining quesadilla. Cut into wedges and serve with yogurt.

name: Baked Salmon Fillet with Raw Broccoli Salad
servings: This method is based on 4 servings
ingredients: 800g salmon fillets skin on, pin bones removed
1 1⁄2 cups (270g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1 head of broccoli (12 oz head) stalks removed & peeled, florets cut
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄4 cup (30g) whole almonds toasted & roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat the oven to 390°F.

Place salmon skin side down in a deep tray. In a bowl, mix salt with water and mix well. The water should be as salty as sea water. Pour over salmon to cover completely and leave for 12 minutes to brine. Drain, place on paper towels and gently dry.

To start the salad, place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Simmer, covered for 15 minutes or until cooked, rest covered for 5 minutes.  Fluff with a fork and transfer to a tray to cool.

Place salmon on a flat baking sheet big enough to fit the whole salmon, brush with oil, and scatter over zest and season with pepper. Bake for approximately 15 minutes or until a fork can pierce easily through the flesh. I personally like it to be slightly rare in the middle,  which is completely safe and even more tender.
At the same time, thinly slice the peeled broccoli stalk and florets with a mandolin (carefully) into a large bowl. Alternatively, you can use a peeler for the stalk and coarsely chop the florets.

In a serving bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, lemon juice, oil, maple syrup and salt and pepper to taste. Add cooled quinoa, broccoli, almonds, most of the herbs and gently mix with your hands. Adjust seasoning and top with shaved parmesan.
Serve fish on a platter, squeeze over lemon juice, scatter with remaining herbs and serve with salad and baguette.

name: Vegan Shepherd's Pie
servings: This method is based on 2 servings
ingredients: 1 sprig of rosemary leaves picked & finely chopped
4 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves stripped
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F.
Cook sweet potato in a saucepan of boiling water for 10 minutes until tender. Drain well and mash. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a large non-stick saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion, garlic, mushrooms, rosemary and half the thyme for 5 minutes until soft.
Add tofu and cook for 5 minutes until beginning to crisp.
Add tomato paste and cook, stirring for a further 2 minutes. Add chickpeas, lentils and stock and cook for 10 minutes until reduced and thickened.
Transfer mixture to a baking dish, cover with mashed potato and bake for 10-15 minutes until potato is golden and hot.
Divide between plates, scatter over remaining thyme and serve.
